title: A Unique and Refreshing  Addition to the Heart of Midtown Manhattan
text:
The Virgin Hotel is exciting for many reasons. And this new property in the prime location of midtown Manhattan lives up to its expectation. The interior design is chic and fun, encompassing a wealth of furniture and art collections that scream the creative and artistic spirits that the Virgin brand is offering. I love the view of my room, with the Empire State Building right outside my window. The windows can be pushed out a bit, allowing fresh air coming in, which I love. 

The dining experience at the Everdene was a delightful and enjoyable one. The food was delicious and the menu offers various healthy options. The service overall lives up to its promise, but I have to say that there can be more improvements on housekeeping’s responsiveness. 

Even though there are plenty of competitive options around this area, I decided to stay here for another night. The GM Ms. Cancino did a great job ensuring that my experience here was a comfortable and memorable one. I’m excited to see what more this hotel can offer once all the rooms and facilities are made available in the coming months, especially the outdoor pool and bar. It will be a hit.

title: A Stylish Oasis
text:
Virgin Hotels New York City offers a refreshing blend of modernity and elegance. 

Impeccable cleanliness pervades the chic, trendy spaces, setting it apart from the rest of hotels in the city (which are quite tired, dull, and have that filthy New York vibe). 

Rooms provide ample space, which is again a rarity in the city, with generous closets and a separate vanity area with excellent lighting. Guests can savor stunning city views, enhanced by floor to ceiling windows that let in so much natural light and actually open to let in fresh air! Despite its super central location, the hotel provides a tranquil retreat, with minimal noise coming into the room if the windows are closed, offering a serene escape from the bustling city. 

Aesthetics is everything for me, and personally I found the red accents (trademark of the Virgin brand), quite appealing. The seasonal pre-selected music playlists on the TV were also quite a nice touch and very fitting to the New York City style. The extra seating space next to the bed along with a table was also appreciated, especially if you are working.

Attention to detail is evident in thoughtful amenities like a wireless charger, and stylish clock that shows time on the ceiling. Virgin Hotels NYC definitely sets a new standard for luxury in the heart of New York and I will be back to this hotel every time I step foot in the city again.

title: Absolutely fabulous hotel!
text: Stayed here 21st March for 6 nights as a family of 4 (two children 9&11). We absolutely loved this hotel. We thought the lobby was cool and chic, we had THE friendliest welcome by the reception staff after our long flight. We got to the room and wow-they do not disappoint. More than enough room for a family to stay comfortably, the separate dressing area is a big bonus. Views amazing, floor to ceiling windows so the room feels light and airy. We met Jordan the restaurant manager and he took us on a tour of the hotel, up to the top floors where a bar will be opening soon-he was wonderful, really personable and just takes great pride in what he does-thank you Jordan! Location is perfect for exploring, everything is on your doorstep. Great breakfast places-Black Seed Bagel, O’L days were great and the Italian pizza place opposite did a great pizza slice. We had read mixed reviews (especially around billing when checking out) but we didn’t experience this-the invoice was instant and everything was correct. We also didn’t find the lifts tricky either, we liked the security of them. We loved this hotel and would come back in a heartbeat!

title: Amazing Check in Experience
text:
Checking into Virgin Hotels was a seamless and amazing experience for me because of Eujin. Right from the start, Eujin's smile cut through the formality of luxury, making me feel genuinely welcomed. It's rare to find someone who turns a routine check-in into a highlight of your day, but Eujin did just that.

Eujin’s approach was effortlessly efficient, blending professionalism with a personal touch that made all the difference. Spotting my fatigue from the journey, Eujin quickly offered a refreshing drink—a simple gesture that meant a lot in the moment.

But it wasn’t just about the smooth process; it was the little things. Eujin seemed to anticipate needs I hadn't even voiced, offering insights into the hotel’s amenities and tips on the best spots around town, all tailored to make my stay better.

From that first interaction, I knew I was in good hands. Eujin didn’t just check me in; they welcomed me into a space where I felt valued and understood. That’s a rare find in any hotel, making this experience one for the books.

title: Amazing location and view, happy staff, and a great stay (with a few caveats)
text:
I chose this hotel for its location and proximity to my destinations on this trip. The stay overall was really positive: every member of the staff I met from the front desk to the room service were exceptionally friendly and welcoming. The room on a high floor had a stunning view of the Empire State Building and the city, bathed in the sun and natural light, and - while not too big - had all the amenities one would need (including a yoga mat, a necessity if you ask me). Unlike some other reviewers, I found the controls on the TV for everything related to my stay quite convenient and easy to navigate. I also appreciated that the room had a compact sit-down make-up/vanity table (extra real estate for all those items that never fit around the sink) and a few closets. 

Another thing worth pointing out is that the hotel is quite fresh. A welcome change from a lot of "tired" properties in NYC.  

The only aspects I enjoyed less (hence knocking off a point) were 1/ the overpriced but average breakfast and 2/ a soft mattress that makes for a less comfortable sleep if you prefer a firmer quality, and 3/ elevators that seemed to be more on the pensive side.  

Overall, I'd consider staying here again.

text:

title: Terrible Stay. Pet Owners Please Go Elsewhere
text:
Pet owners please read my review thoroughly. DON'T STAY HERE. The one star I give here other than the fact that I cannot give no star is for the nice service provided by one member of their concierge team. Other than that, by all means I would never return to this hotel and I would recommend others to do the same for your own sake.

I booked my stay in early January and my stay was in mid-February. One of the reasons for booking here is that they do not charge any pet fees which is rare for 5-star hotels at such locations. However, I was told at check-in that I have to pay $100 for the pet fee because they instituted a new policy a week ago (in the end they "waived" that fee for me due to another abysmal problem which I will take about later). For starter, I cannot fathom how I am responsible for the policy they recently instituted given that I made my reservation way ahead in advance. In addition, I received no messages or tips from the hotel saying that they have this new policy and they now charge a pet fee. Even in that scenario, it would be prudent for them to express an apology for this change and offer refunds or other accommodations. However, they never did any of those. To me, this is blatant FRAUD.

Unfortunately, this is not the worst part of the stay. As I was saying, I was traveling with pets and they spent 99% of the time inside the hotel room (the other 1% of the time they walked around in corridors and the lobby). On the 2nd night of our stay late into the night, we discovered that one of our puppies had not only 1 but 2 giant ticks attached to her skin. For people who do not own pets, ticks may carry Lyme disease which is lethal to both canine and humans alike. We had to take her to a pet emergency at 2 am in the morning where we spent $250. Based on the description, it is not difficult to deduce that however unlikely, the room we stayed in contained ticks hidden somewhere. We then returned to their hotel, showed the front desk the ticks we retrieved from the vet, and demanded a room swap. The staff on duty was nice enough to offer us a different room and waive our pet fee. However, with incidents of such magnitude happening, I would expect, from 5-star hotels like themselves, calls or messages from hotel management. The only thing I received was my receipt of the stay.

Again, any of the problems I mentioned above would be no problem at all for a motel or perhaps even a 3-star hotel. But this is simply unacceptable for a 5-star hotel with their branding.

title: Great location, clean & modern  BUT avoid restaurant and service from reception is shocking and be aware of the 25us$ cr
text:
This hotel is modern and clean. Location is fantastic. 8 mins walk to rockefella  centre and Maddison square gardens and 16-18 mins walk to Times Square. The hotel is one of the nicest I’ve stayed in BUT avoid the Restaurnt. We went for breakfast and for 4 meals and 4 drinks the bill was 160us$. (2 adults and 2 young kids) that is extortionate and the food wasn’t great quality. It wasn’t even a full breakfast. It was 1 piece of toast, 2 eggs and some potatos for 35us$. Seriously ???? Down the road there were much better cafes that cost a quarter of the price and much better food and quality 
We were told we got 25 us$ per day for food or beverages including room service but not the mini bar which was fine. We were told this 3 times, by 3 different people on 3 different occasions as I had a few questions to ask so kept going back. When we came to check out I advised her that we used 2 of the 25us$ credits on two days. (1 each day which was allowed) The receptionist then told us that it was 25us$ for the whole stay. I said that’s not what we have been told by 3 different members of staff and also it’s on your T&c’s which I showed her. I also was told when I questioned it that if it was per duration why was I told that the credit cannot be rolled over to the next day if not used??  If it’s just 1 credit and I’ve used the 1 credit why would you even say you can’t roll it over. Then she replied yes you’re right you can’t roll over the credit if you don’t use it. ???? What???? She just contradicted herself. Can’t understand how a Virgin staff at a Virgin hotel doesn’t know their own offers and terms. She said she would take this off. I asked her for the bill and she said she would email it to me. Which I found it odd as I normally sign to authorise for payments that will come out of my bank. Off to the airport we went home. Checked my emails and they haven’t taken no credit off at all. The bill was 250 us$.  Just checked my bank statement and they have taken out £296. ????? We didn’t touch the mini bar so not sure why we have been charged more than the bill they sent us. Which now reading reviews they’ve overcharged a few people and never got a refund. This is fraud. No wonder they wait to email you a receipt after you leave. 

Also we asked for a morning wake up call for our flight back. Never got that

We also lost one of our duty free bags. We may have left it in the taxi on the way in but I asked on 3 occasions if they could check their cctv to see if we did bring it into the hotel with us. Never got an answer even though I was promised I would get a response. This had my suspicions.  
In the first day our safe wouldn’t work. We asked if they could come and fix it. I was told we have to wait for the engineer to come I said ok can you call him. He said he’s on site but don’t know where he is and don’t know how long it will be until he comes ?!! I was told I would have to wait in my room until he came ???  As if. !!!!  

This is genuine feedback from a gold member of Virgin Atlantic with nearly 1 million points. If this is how you treat your customers you will sure loose customers. 

I have emailed the hotel directly and will take this further if my money isn’t refunded.

title: Ok option if you can book a low rate
text:
We stayed at the Virgin Hotels location in New York City last minute to enjoy a nice shower after our building had a gas outage. 

When we arrived, the front desk checked us in. Everything was fairly typical: they let us know of the amenities in the building including the gym, restaurant, and spa. They gave us a 50$ coupon for spa services, which I found a little silly. The spa charges 75$ to use the amenities, not including any treatments, but there are many opportunities in New York to enjoy a spa for better value. I felt the coupon was just intended to make you feel you were getting a good deal when in reality, I don’t think it was.

The gym was standard. It has techno gym equipment which was really nice but for lifters like me, you know that 50 lbs dumbbells are not enough to replace a full gym experience. There were some machines, but were not thorough enough to replace a fitness enthusiast’s routine. 

The pool club was closed as it was winter.

When we got to our room, there were a few cleanliness issues. The toilet appeared not to be cleaned well and there was trash in the bins. There were also leftover coffee pods in the coffee machine. Honestly, because we were just trying to have a more comfortable place for the night, we did not complain. I’m sure if we had said something they would have been apologetic - but I would be surprised if that room had been inspected by a lead housekeeper.

The layout of the room was not my favorite. Over 60% of the room was a combination bathroom and dressing area, while the actual living (bed + sitting) room was less than 40% of the space. I might be picky but I did not like that there was no tile outside the shower so the  faux wooden floor would get wet after showering and we would mop up the water with a towel.

The bed was a king and was comfortable. I enjoyed the linens although they did have some scratchy tags facing the head of the bed. 

Our view from the room was amazing. Best view of the Empire State I’ve ever seen. Only issue was that the curtains could not be opened so you could enjoy the view from any of the furniture, instead the curtains opened to an apartment building. When the curtains were opened only 60% of the glass was exposed. Still, the view was worth it from the corner of the room we could see it from.

Checkout is super easy. No complaints. 

Overall, I think it was good for what we needed. I’m sure the rate we paid was fairly low because it was a last minute booking but I would not pay much more than 150$ a night for this property. It seems to style itself as a mid range hotel with mid range amenities but felt more like staying in a newly built low range hotel.

title: Not what we have come to expect from Virgin.
text:
We are Virgin “In the Know” members and have enjoyed stays in several locations including Chicago (our favorite), Nashville, and Glasgow. I’m sorry to report that this location is disappointing, to say the least. 

We cancelled a Hilton Garden Inn to stay at the Virgin based on our previous experiences. We wish we hadn’t. It cost considerably more and was a bit farther from our planned activities.  This would have been okay if the stay had been as expected.  Instead, it was nothing special and lacked the touches to which we’ve become accustomed. 

The lobby was very bare and lacked the cool vibe that we’ve seen in others. The room itself was as expected. Small, but comfortable. The bed is always nice, so that was a positive. 

The real problem was the maid service. The first full day, we walked in on the housekeeper after being gone touring for nine hours.  She quickly left without fully finishing. The second day, after being gone 7 hours, we returned to a room that hadn’t been cleaned at all. Given that we were planning to chill for a couple hours before going back out, the room never was cleaned. We called and asked for fresh towels. 

The last thing I’ll mention is the daily happy hour. We were offered one drink.  At every other location we’ve been to, the happy hour for the Know is drinks for an hour. That’s part of why we switched.  Apparently, New York is different. The inconsistency is a problem. 

For the money and what we’d expected, we now wish we’d stuck with our original reservation.  They have always been consistent location to location and seem to be on their game. Not so much here, I’m afraid.

title: Fantastic Experience and AMAZING Staff!
text:
We live in upstate NY and travel to NYC in December every year and have had a favorite hotel for a number of years. We decided to give a new place a try as we wanted to move away from Times Square. We were not disappointed in our choice of Virgin Hotels NYC.

The biggest reason we had such an amazing experience this year was the staff. Every single person we interacted with was friendly, attentive, and helpful. We had some fun conversations with several staff members and three in particular went out of their way to make sure our stay was great. Christopher Vega, and Darnell consistently made sure that everything was going well. As staff members working in the lobby they always said hello when we passed and chatted with us several times. Darnell was fun to bounce ideas off of for things to do / places to eat. They have a larger than life personality that we noticed the second we checked in and always made us smile.

Christopher really went above and beyond for us on what was supposed to be our last day. We checked out seamlessly and went to Penn station to wait for our train. We had delays due to flooding on the tracks and were concerned we wouldn't get home. I went back to the hotel (which is super close to Penn) and talked to Christopher to see if they could squeeze us in for another night if we needed (aka hold a room). They chatted with their manager and were able to work something out for us. We decided to just go for it after all and stay an extra night since there was a lot of flooding in our town too. They got us right into a new room without having to wait until check in time and didn't charge us extra! We ended up having a great bonus night in the city - not a bad place to get "stuck"!

We really enjoyed the restaurant and ate there several times. Cool atmosphere and delicious food / cocktails. We are both gluten free due to Celiac and from the moment we first stepped in Jack went above and beyond to make sure our food wasn't going to make us sick. They checked in anytime they saw us there and even stepped in to help when we had an issue with a language barrier with one of the waiters. The waiter was still super friendly and attentive we just had a hard time explaining things to them. Gluten free can be very tricky!

The hotel itself was fun, funky, clean, and unique. We stayed in an Empire Chamber King our entire stay, including the bonus night and the views were nothing short of spectacular. Our rooms were clean, and spacious with comfortable beds. There was plenty of space in each closet for our suitcases and belongings. I loved the curtain over them to hide the stuff inside and keep the room feeling nice. Room service was FAST and reasonably priced. The minibar was very well stocked and also reasonably priced.

Honestly we loved everything about Virgin NYC including the Nomad neighborhood. We will be back next year and cannot wait!

I believe that Darnell embodies everything that the Virgin Hotels would want in an employee. Darnell greeted us with kindness, knowledge, and great information. Darnell even worked with us to upgrade our room and made this trip one of the best of our lives. Darnell seriously deserves all of the praise!!

title: Customer service needs improvement
text: This was my first time staying at a Virgin property, and I don't think I will be back. Although the hotel is new and very clean, I did not like the way the rooms were arranged. The room is basically split down the middle, with a bedroom at one end, and closets, sink, separate shower, toilet, and a small makeup table on the other. There is a sliding door that can be left open or closed. The room lacked additional seating areas. You either sat on the bed or a small stool near the makeup table. The room is separated so that one person can get up and get dressed without disturbing the other person sleeping. But once you went into the other area, there was no place to sit and have coffee or just hang out. I felt this design made the room feel smaller. The other issue I had with the hotel is a missong wallet and lack of concern from the hotel staff. The night before  we were checking out, I realized my wallet was missing. It had all of my credit cards and drivers license in it. I had left it on the bed that morning while in a rush, but when we came back to the room, the bed had new sheets and the wallet was gone. I suspected it was rolled up in the sheets and tossed in the laundry area. I immediately called the front desk to explain the situation. I was told that someone would get right back with me. Several hours went by and 2 more calls to the front desk, but I never was able to speak with house keeping or security. The next morning I called the front desk 2 more times, until finally security came to our room at 11 am, after I complained that we had to leave for the airport at 12 and I did not have an ID to board the plane. Security was no help at all. He wrote down a few notes and said he was going to make some calls and get back with us ASAP. By 12 we went down to the lobby to get a car for the airport. The security guard was chatting with other guests and basically just hanging out in the lobby. We made eye contact and I was walking over to ask him about the status of my wallet, when he hurried away and went into a room for employees only. I did not expect the hotel to find my wallet, but I did expect them to at least try and locate it, or communicate with us better. There are many hotels in New York, and I just feel the Virgin is lacking in customer service, which is why we will choose a different one next time we visit the city.

title: Your guests are more important than having fun when u are working!
text: Ok rooms but the people at the reception was more interested with talking amongst them self than talking notice of their guests. Anybode would be able to go in with out them noticing!! Did not feel safe.

title: Virgin Hotels NYC - Worth It!
text: Room was very thoughtful and comfortable. Outlets were exactly where they should be. Light switches easy. Bedding was very comfortable. NYC views from the room, on 32nd floor were beyond incredible. Very spacious room by NYC standards, and excellent lighting - which for a business traveler is critical, but often lacking. Arrival sequence and departure sequence were seamless, and the doormen were very helpful. Ate breakfast twice at Everdene and dinner twice. The space is gorgeous. Food was delicious. I would highly recommend the butternut squash soup and the tuna tartare. Next time in town, i will come for drinks with friends as the lounge area was a lot of fun and at night, the live music was great. I will be back!

title: Broadway via Virgin
text:
Great hotel. Staff was very attentive and kind. 
Chad at the front desk helped us with all of our concerns . He made the difference… definitely an asset to Virgin Hotels.
We mostly had a heavy Broadway itinerary and although it’s not in the heart of Times Square it was an easy walk.

title: The Best Hotel in NYC- By Far
text: This hotel is better than any of my past stays in NYC… by far! The staff are amazing (RJ was very helpful and considerate), and they go above and beyond to ensure customer satisfaction. We checked in as skeptical people, and are checking out today as loyal customers. We’ll be coming back very soon, thank you Virgin Hotels!

title: Best Staff Ever!
text: A beautiful hotel with a wonderful staff! My company was lodging her over the weekend as well as holding events here and it went super well thanks to the staff. Chris is guest services along with Key, Justin, Marcel, and Henrique made checking in and our students experience top notch. Jack, Angele, Kalvin, Nibenam, Jenny, and Marvin made all of our dining experiences incredible. I could not have had a better time. Very professional and friendly! These employees listed above deserve recognition and a raise!  We will absolutely be using this hotel the next time we hist events in NYC!

title: Great stay!!
text: Excellent hotel!! We did have a few minor issues in our room (coffee machine & privacy indicator at door were out of order), but concierge handled everything expeditiously. View was absolutely incredible. Great location - walked everywhere. 5*

title: Great Experience
text: Great experience at the Virgin Hotel NYC from start to finish. Starting with a very warm and refreshing welcome from Darnell at reception!  Our suite had stunning views and the lighting in the bathroom was great for make-up application! Loved the overall design of the hotel.  Be sure to check out Everdene on the 3rd floor and enjoy a cocktail and take in all the beauty, especially the book display.  The gym was clean and well-appointed as well. Highly recommend this hotel when traveling to the city and plan to stay again soon.

title: SPA REVIEW
text: NYC local specifically reviewing the spa. I booked a 90 minute deep tissue massage, but was not told the spa is still under construction. While the massage itself was great, it was not worth the $$$ price tag considering I could hear loud banging and sawing over the relaxing spa music. I also did not have access to all the facilities as some of the amenities were under construction as well. Wish I had been told in advance as it will be a lovely space once finished  (consider calling to make sure the same thing doesn’t happen to you)

title: Excellent Property to Stay in NYC
text: Staff was extremely courteous and attentive. View of the Empire State Building from our room was amazing. Concierge staff helped with a special request that made our trip special. In room dining / room service was quick. Overall great experience.

title: Virgin Hotel NYC every moment is special
text: Stellar! We stayed in room 3302 with the most amazing view of the Empire State Building and Times Square. The room was fantastic. Comfortable bed, extras touches with the linens, towels. The in room bar is stocked with great selections. The restaurant was excellent. We had a late lunch and brunch the next day. Don’t skip the burger, egg sandwich, breakfast potatoes or most of all the spicy Bloody Mary.  Above all this & most of all the staff. Starting with Glenn Waters and each and every person was so kind, helpful and truly wanted each guest to have a wonderful stay. Thank you Virgin Hotel NYC you made my stay something so memorable - we will be back!

title: Modern, upmarket hotel in perfect location
text: This was our first visit to New York and was slightly nervous having read some of the recent reviews.  Checked in with Glen and everything went smoothly.  We had an Empire view room on floor 36 and couldn't stop saying Wow at the view.  Hotel is a 10 minute walk from Penn Station and perfectly located for a Manhattan stay.  Didn't really use the facilities as we were out for breakfast and missed happy hour in the bar.   Room was plenty big enough and the layout fine.  Not your traditional hotel layout but it worked really well for the two of us.  Would hapilly stay here again.  Didn't receive a copy of the bill on check out but a quick email and the bill was sent over.

title: The staff was amazing!
text: Greeted from the start by amazing Christopher V. and not only was he absolutely wonderful then in attending to our needs but, it continued throughout the whole length of our stay. All of the employees from the start to end were gracious, helpful, and clearly cared about their guests time at the hotel. The hotel has lots of amazing amenities to offer from the spa to the outdoor terrace and restaurant. The food at the in-house Everdene restaurant was great and not overpriced for being in Manhattan. The spa was beautiful and relaxing with a multitude of services offered with many amazing therapists including Gloria and Jackie. It was the kind of experience you would hope to have when going to a hotel. Will definitely be returning on our next visit into the city. 5 ⭐️

title: I mean - no bathroom?
text:
I‘ve been to Nee York City many times, and it‘s never easy to find a good hotel. 

This hotel is in a great location, it‘s new and clean. They fail to let you know that the rooms are so tiny that there is literally no real place to put your clothes, and there is no real bathroom. When you enter the room, you are standing in the bathroom, literally. A glass door to a toilet cubicle, a glass door to a shower cubicle, the sink is literally at the door. 

There is absolutely no space to put one suitcase, let alone two. If you use the room by yourself or are here only for a weekend, it might work ok.

title: above and beyond
text: I was not a guest but Jenny went out of her way to help me with an issue and her patience and good nature is a credit to the brand. Kudos to her and also to Chris, General Manager. Wishing them all the best for 2024.

title: Not what we expected from the brand virgin
text:
My partner has left a review. But ours are different and I believe his to be too kind. We were very excited about our trip to NY. It’s such a shame, the beginning  wasn’t what we expected. Have stayed in many hotels all over the world, so The cons first. 
On arrival there was lots of clicking on the computer. We were then given our room number. We had booked for the Chamber King empire room. Which in a email, we were told would be on level 22 and above. Our room was 12 something. We expressed our concerns, to be told we “definitely had the room we paid for”, and if we came back tomorrow they would move us and try and accommodate us with our requests for a higher level room. We were tired and just wanted to rest. We went to our room. My partner then found the email about our room type being above level 22. He popped back down. He spoke to Glen who was one of the supervisors, who told him, “we definitely wasn’t in the room we paid for”. Apparently the rooms had been over booked. We were taken to the bar and given complimentary cocktails while they sorted it. They did manage to sort it, so was someone else, then not in the room they paid for? It wasn’t the start we wanted for our holiday. The views from our then room on 35, was exactly why we paid more. It was the views we wanted. The breakfast package is awful, don’t bother. Only have choice of American or continental. Most mornings something was missing. On the menu it’s priced as the highest, so unsure why you can’t choose something else. We often had something else out and about, as it wasn’t enough to start the day on. 
The drinks in the Everdeen are over priced. A bottle of water will set you back $12!!  Lifts take getting used too. 
The pros - 
Fantastic central location. Rooms (when you get the right one) are spacious, clean with the most amazing view of the city and Empire State Building. Extra Coffee pods are available on request. Most of the staff are welcoming,  friendly and helpful. If they cannot do your request, they will certainly try to accommodate. 

On the whole we had a good stay. However, we wouldn’t rush back to a virgin hotel, due to check in, the breakfast package. Shame  really.

Also just to add, the delta flight was above the expectations and the food was very good. The virgin flights food, was below the standard we would have expected.

title: Endrik was amazing
text: If you are looking for genuine, caring, and truly kind service, look no further. Thank you for the lovely time we had! My mom, sister and I had a fantastic time in the city, and the time we had at this hotel was the cherry on top! Endrik was the definition of pure hospitality, and deserves this recognition❤️ He went above and beyond and we were truly grateful for that! Clean and comfortable rooms, and the view speaks for itself. The rest of the staff was also helpful. Please consider staying here if you’re wanting to visit.

title: The Virgin Hotel Experience in Manhattan
text: Excellent Work by the entire staff to keep the guests happy. It was a nice and clean hotel as it’s newly built but great care has been taken to provide a business traveler a good experience. The staff at the hotel most notably Endrik, Chris, Glen and Jeannette went out of their way to take care of the guest requests in a timely manner.

title: Virgin Hotels New York City
text:
Room was amazing with views of The Empire State Building and a seperate dressing room - this made it feel like your own mini manhattan apartment! 

The hotel reception is very dark and underwhelming - no grandeur at all. The hotel lift system also caused much confusion for many guests! 

The hotel likes you to contact them with Service Requests through the Lucy App - although most of the time they just ignore them, so it’s pointless. 

I found the customer service levels at this property were severely lacking considering it is a part of the Virgin brand and for the room rates charged. I appreciate it is a new property but there really is a lot of work to be done! 

My room wasn’t cleaned on several occasions and when it was things were missed like dirty towels in the shower. 

I ordered Room Service one evening and the order was missed meaning it was nearly 2 hours from ordering. They still charged me the Tray Fee and Service charge. Also the dirty tray was still outside my room some 18 hours later! 

Reception were very slow on checkin and checkout - the lady just stared at the screen whilst constantly clicking on a mouse with no explanation as to what she was doing. I was overcharged on departure and basically told when i queried it to contact Guest Services via email. A manager did eventually resolve this. 

I feel genuinely disappointed that i have had to give this hotel just an average rating as in terms of location and room style - it really has the WOW factor. 

Unfortunately the service lets it down - staff need to be more friendly and less pretentious. Guests pay a great deal to stay here and are not an inconvenience.

title: Hotel was okay, follow up and support are nonexistent...
text: Unknown additional charges were added to my room stay, after multiple calls to the hotel and messages left on the voicemail of the finance team, I am still trying to get an answer from Virgin and a final bill for my stay.

title: Incredible views of the city from higher floors!
text: Such a stunning hotel! They upgraded us to a higher floor (29th) and it had a view of the Empire state building and just stunning skyline of the city. We dined at Everdene for breakfast the morning that we were leaving and everything was delicious. 11/10. Would highly recommend and will definitely be back.

title: Best hotel experience ever
text: From the moment we walked inside the hotel we were amazed. Red carpet entrance with a greeting from the bellman. Darnell checked us in and was absolutely fabulous. He gave us a room with the most beautiful view of the Empire State Building. He also went above and beyond and sent us up a cake for my girlfriend’s birthday. If I could give this hotel a million stars I would. Thank you virgin hotels and staff. Keep being amazing!

title: Lovely stay!
text: We were welcomed by Glenn, who was so lovely and helpful with all of our questions and queries about our stay and even recommended a food place for us to go that night. The room had a beautiful view and was very modern and spacious, amazing view of the empire state ! Relaxing and enjoyable atmosphere in the restaurant and had two amazing waiters serving us throughout our stay. Adrianno was so attentive to us and made sure we were happy with everything - really made everything relaxed and pleasant while dining. On our last night we had dinner in the restaurant, served by Dorrian - who perfectly explained the dishes on the menu to us and shared his reccos. He then also gave us some really useful info about thanksgiving parade (we’re British so had no idea!). We would definitely stay again. Thanks to all the lovely staff who made our stay in New York so memorable!

title: An amazing stay in NYC at the Virgin- 5 STARS
text: Upon arrival, was met with the most warmest greeting from none other than Darnell (can’t miss him- he makes his presence be known & wears the most fabulous glasses) who made sure we had an amazing room with a great view. He immediately let us know where to go for the best breakfast and made sure that we were acquainted with everything we needed to know about our stay so that it was the best stay possible. Later in the evening, we went to the 3rd floor where their lounge is- and it is a VIBE. It’s called the Everdene. Live music from a live band was playing so we sat down and ordered from Claudine who put us onto a bomb Rosè. We ordered 2 bottles and then became besties with Miguel, who I think may have been a manager. When I tell you we had a ball there. Our stay is still ongoing- we’ve come back to a clean room and so far everyone has been extremely friendly and hospitable. Would definitely go back again.

title: Well located hotel with amazing views
text:
Reading all of the reviews I was a bit worried about this booking but I needn't have been. Check in was friendly, swift and helpful - they walked me to the lift and showed me how to use the control panel (very similar to a cruise ship, not that complex).
Whenever I had a question for the reception staff they were friendly and patient and I did ask them a few things about the local area etc. Shout out to Julio for his taxi wrangling skills.

I loved the room - great view of the Empire State Building with lots of little touches that showed a real understanding of travellers needs. Very comfy bed, black out blinds and a clock radio you can actually dim.

I ordered room service once, it turned up very quickly and was very good - better than the breakfast in the restaurant itself in fact which was tasty but not great value.

I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again - I probably wouldnt bring my kids but it was perfect for me.

title: Modern and close to so much
text: This is a new hotel with a modern feel. We had two double beds for three. The room was bright, clean and the bed was comfy. The shower was hot with red flower toiletries. The view from the room was amazing. The hotel bar had great cocktails and service. The only issue was the elevator system, to complicated for my liking.

title: Best Hotel Stay in New York
text: This hotel blew me away! I was visiting the city for both business and pleasure. The first person we encounted was Dennis the Bellperson. We was ready and waiting to take care of us. Then Darnell at the front desk checked us in and was amazing! He made recommendations for places to eat, place to hang out and was an overall gem. It was the heartfelt service for me. During my stay, I visited the funny library and was helped by Noah. He made me feel special by remembering my drink and chatting with me during my wait.  This is my go-to place in New York! I love the city, but I love this hotel even more!

title: Exceptional
text:
We visited Virgin Hotels NYC as 2 couples. We upgraded to suites and wow! They are really something! Views of the Empire State Building and so much space!
The hotel is wonderful but has a few teething problems still. 
The pool is seasonal which it doesn't say on the website so you can't access the pool whenever you want. Some of the menu at the restaurant is absolutely exceptional but we have a chicken and pork main course and they were both so dry they were inedible. 
The location of the hotel is absolutely exceptional and you can get everywhere in the city very easily. 
The staff are absolutely wonderful and will try and help you however they can. I think it is safe to say we will be staying here when we are next in NY.

title: Lovely hotel but staff don’t know policy about breakfast packages and lie
text:
Breakfast package is setup to Rio you off.  Do not book it.  Staff can’t explain or have been told not to.  See image of my reservation of what you are supposed to get.  What you really get is lies.  
When booking from the virgin website if you book a breakfast package, you are supposed tio get American or continental breakfast per guest.  Not $50 per room/night as I was told on check out.  There were 3 of us and this cost us $250 on top of the breakfast package at the end of 5 nights.  
Every day we were told different things by wait staff or reception.  Eat what you like and it will be credited one told us.  There is $35 credit per guest daily another told us.  I’ve attached what the virgin website says in my booking and I would like the fee of $250 returned as I did not consent to anything ithan free breakfast.  At no point did be eat more that the value of  $35 anyway.  
That said, it’s a lovely hotel and staff were always friendly to us.  They were Felicia to us to arrange a room for us prior to arrival and we are most grateful.  
The smeg is lovely but is too noisy at night.  We asked could we plug it out and were told to wear earplugs and suck it up.  Rude????   Told if the products spoiled we would be billed.  Petty.  I asked to remove it and it was not removed.

title: Great views and hotel, just a break down in communication before and during the stay.
text:
A beautiful hotel, modern style and rooms. Our room was fantastic and it has a complete clear view of the empire state. 

I stayed in a room with my two sisters, it was spacious, clean and modern.

I had to ask the front desk to kit us out with everything in the room for 3 people as it didn’t cater for us all when we arrived. Robes, glasses, cups and towels something i don’t think I should have to raise. 

The coffee machine didn’t work in the room the whole time and I asked a number of staff and cleaning staff but it was never fixed. I would say that all we wanted was a kettle so we could make a breakfast tea which I brought with me and milk. So doesn’t need to be fancy with a coffee machine. 

I asked as soon as we arrived whether breakfast was included and we were promised an email from the front desk after it was researched but that email never came. 

Prior to arriving I emailed the hotel (a few weeks before) asking if they could source a ‘50’ balloon for my sisters birthday and for it to be in the room when we arrived, I had no response atall. There were some breakdowns in communication which I feel brings down the star quality of this hotel. I know it’s in the early days but it’s those little things that make a difference. I look at the price of the hotel too and realise that we could of got the same quality at the Ace hotel which is on the same street.

Just a word of advice, we arrived and 400 dollars was taken off our card it was swiftly returned once we checked out but it was a huge chunk of our holiday dosh so thinking about it I really wished I’d put that on a credit card and not used my holiday dollars. 

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay but a few details being polished would of made the trip perfect.

title: Caution Needed
text:
Caution: before booking this hotel, it is an absolute must that you get Virgin Hotels New York to give you a written guarantee.
The Great: Jeanette and Darnell, who worked at the front desk, were delightful and professional. They were an absolute pleasure. We can say the same thing for Juliette one of the managers. Indeed, each of their staff that we personally interacted with were fantastic. Nevertheless, there were severe hotel issues.
My wife and I decided to take a break from our hectic work lives in Florida and take in some Broadway shows in New York.  So, we sought recommendations from American Express Platinum. They enthusiastically recommended Virgin Hotels New York. We booked a three-night stay beginning from Thursday, October 26 to Sunday, October 29, 2023.
After reviewing Virgin Hotels’ boast about raising a cocktail glass to the setting sun, eat your dinner with a view or snack on some bar bites under the stars in their “rooftop oasis, and dining in the playful and colour-filled space of the Library & Dining Room at their Everdene restaurant”, we took the bait.
After our Broadway show on Friday night,  since we did not eat dinner before the show, we assumed that we would be able to go back to Virgin Hotels for dinner and drinks. That was not to be the case. To our shock, the hotel had shut down all dining and bar areas throughout the hotel on Friday night because they had rented out all of those areas to a third party, which was hosting a Halloween party that the attendees had to pay for online. Hotel guest did not have access to that devastatingly loud party even if they wanted to attend. This meant that at nearly 10:00 p.m. at night, we were forced to travel throughout the city to find some place to eat and have drinks. The Virgin Hotel failed to post, or announce, any prior warning to their hotel guests.
On Saturday, October 28, 2023, we had another show to attend that was starting at 7:30 p.m. Before coming to New York, we had made an early dinner reservation at a restaurant that was difficult to get a reservation for. My wife and I decided we would just have dinner room service to save us some time. Therefore, we canceled the dinner reservation with restaurant that we made several weeks before. I called in our in-room dinner order, which included wine. The hotel informed me that our order would arrive in about 45 minutes. When I called an hour later, the hotel staff told me that while they were aware of our dinner order, the order was never fulfilled. At no time did anyone at the hotel call to tell us that we would not be getting any of the food or drinks that we ordered. By that time, we had to make a mad dash to the Broadway show without any dinner.
Adding insult to injury, the Halloween party that took place on Friday, and which caused all of the dining and bar areas to be shut off to hotel guests would be repeated on Saturday night, again with all of the dining and bar areas shut off for their hotel guests. 
Warning: There was absolutely no way to enjoy the hotel’s dining facilities on any day during that weekend. Make sure before you make reservations with this hotel that you have a firm grasp on which hotel facilities guests will be able to use during your stay. This includes, Halloween, Easter, St. Patrick’s Day, President’s Day, and all other major and minor holidays.
Dining in Virgin Hotels may not be available to you as a hotel guest. Also, avoid in-room dining if you have other options.

title: What more can you ask for:  great location, friendly, helpful staff, affordable.
text: What a welcoming vibe.  Staff were friendly, warm and so helpful.  Room used space in inventive and creative ways.  Very comfortable, close to Penn station and subway lines.  Price was affordable for NYC.  What more can you ask for?

title: Very cool place.
text: The room was spotlessly clean and modern. I had giant windows with a view of New York City buildings. I liked the view, but there were no black out curtains so the light made it difficult to sleep.  I thought the entry process was a little bit too industrial. The elevators were confusing to operate and other people were having the same problem. My only real beef is that the room was extremely expensive and they didn’t even have a bottle of water in the room. I thought they could’ve sprung for a bottle of water or two.

title: Stylish stay with great views in central location
text:
This hotel has a fun design concept and lies in a great location. My kids were awed by the views on the Empire State Building from our room. Staff were fantastic in the bar (which was great as well!)

What we disliked: Unfortunately pricey (but what would you expect in Manhattan?!?)

title: Hidden 'destination fee'
text: I have always had great stays at Virgin properties and was excited to finally try the NYC one.  The location is great and I had a fabulous view of the empire state building which gave me great joy.  However I am left with a terrible taste in my mouth after noticing a stealth 'destination fee' on my bill.  I wish I had read some reviews in advance.  This wasn't disclosed on the website, at booking, on my reservation confirmation, or at check-in or check-out.  I contacted the property to inquire about what the fee covered and was told that it covers amenities such as laundry, wifi, the restaurant, pool, and bars.  This may be the most egregious destination fee/resort fee I have ever seen.  A fee for the privilege of paying for laundry and to visit the restaurant?  Other hotels at least now provide things like bottled water, a restaurant discount, a free drink, coffee, etc. to soften the blow of the fee and make you think you are getting something in return.  Not so here.  Not even a bottle of water.  Deliberately concealing this fee has done nothing but ruin my impression of this hotel.

title: Are you hip enough to stay here?
text: We like the location of the hotel but maybe not hip enough to stay here.  The wait time was long and our staff was relatively new so when you ask a few questions he had to confer with other coworkers.  He did put us up on the higher floors, which helps with the noise.  Walls are thin, you can hear other room's business from letting the door slam to other business.  The swim area was closed, so didn't get a good shot of the Empire State bldg, but it is nice.  On 6th there's more characters, and on B'way is really Ktown.  No matter what, good food is nearby.  Checking out was painful, for some reason, there's only couple elevators that were operable out of 6, so trying to get to the lobby literally took 10 mins.  That was undesirable for sure.  Then when we got there, only 2 staff available for check out.  They do offer to hold our luggage if we need it, it's nice that check out is at noon.

title: It’s the little things…
text:
Virgin has built a great property in a fantastic location in NYC.  We stayed just after the property opened and had a great experience.  The hotel is still fantastic but or recent customer experience was much more akin to staying at a budget hotel.

We had a couple of unpleasant experiences with staff but the most telling was upon check out Sunday Morning.  We were informed that the hotel could not hold our bags because there was a convention starting that day and they had booked the entire property.  This left my wife and I in NYC for the day with our luggage…..

I know that Virgin tries hard to surprise and amaze their customers, it seems that should be the case whether you rent one room or the entire property.

title: Some very good points but poor communication
text:
Some excellent things about our stay and some poor:

Food - very good indeed
Restaurant staff - very friendly and helpful 
Beds - amazingly comfortable!
Room - very nice, black out blinds and I loved that window opens because I hate AC.
Minibar supplies - we didn't use, but there was a huge selection of drinks and snacks available.
Porters - excellent, as I've read other reviewers saying, they were so helpful.
Outside bar/restaurant on 3rd floor - very nice atmosphere, lots of lovely plants and good view of ESB.
Location - very central for walking around Manhattan 

The poor things:

Non-existent customer service communication by emaiI. I had emailed the hotel several times in advance of arrival asking simple questions but received NO REPLIES.

Check in staff very abrupt, gave absolutely no information about the hotel/breakfast times/directions to room/how to use lifts (card needed).  I have since received an email as a result of my review saying this is being addressed)

Room attendants - made beds, but rarely replenished coffee, milk, toilet paper,  even when we asked.. we had to call reception several times for supplies.

Outside pool area and bar were closed - due to season.

I was concerned before our visit about the many reviews that talk about errors in charging,  non-refunded deposits, surplus charges etc, but our deposit and an erroneous minibar charge! Were refunded ok.

title: Comfortable hotel let down by some poor service.
text:
We arrived from the U.K. on a very wet Saturday afternoon and first impressions seemed ok. The lobby area was nice enough. The welcome from reception staff was lacklustre with no explanation of anything at all in the hotel and certainly no smiles - New York vibes already.
Our room was a Sky Chamber Empire View and it had fabulous views of the Empire State Building, and the city - a real plus point. The room was a bit small but the bed was very comfortable and the amenities were pretty basic. The daily room servicing was great - discreet and efficient. The AC/heating was really loud if switched on but was effective.  Fridge also seemed to be noisy. Location was good - handy for most things. The room felt like a refuge from the chaos that can be NYC. Lifts were efficient and speedy. 
We stayed for 5 nights and the stay was ‘fine’. The service let the hotel down, and we were not demanding guests. The Everdene bar and the Library restaurant were lovely to look at and had a nice atmosphere but the service here was pretty poor. Grumpy staff, not terribly helpful, and to be honest at times we felt like asking for the standard drinks/food/anything was an inconvenience. For this price point, we expected more. Indifference bordering on rude would be how I’d characterise it. One staff member complained about his colleague to us. That felt awkward. The only staff who were consistently welcoming and recognised us were the porters - other staff could learn a lesson from their excellence! Apart from that, it felt anonymous and indifferent. Not sure I’d return for the price - the service didn’t match it.

title: Awful Customer Service
text:
I have no real words to describe the poor customer service we received at this hotel. We were looking forward to this stay so much and had the highest hopes with it being a Virgin hotel. We had an amazing Virgin flight out to NYC and couldn’t wait to check in.
 
We arrived and went to check in. This was the start of the awful service. The stay was prepaid so we just had a surety to pay. We were told that we owed the full balance. We explained that it was paid and could prove it through Virgin holiday site and via the bank. We were continually told that we had to pay the balance and we were getting no where till someone else came over who was clearly a manager and straight away said that the balance was paid. We were offered no information on the hotel in fact there was no conversation at all. We paid the surety and put it down to a bad day.
 
We went to the room which was lovely. The view was amazing. The facilities exactly as we expected. We could not fault it in anyway.
 
We then received a message from the bank saying that Virgin hotels had tried to take a large amount of money and was it fraudulent transaction. We went back to reception to discuss this and were ultimately called liars and they had only taken the surety. The only thing the same person told us was to call the bank. I asked to use the phone as we had low battery. The phone was thrown across the desk at us.
The bank confirmed that they had only taken the surety – because they had blocked the other transaction. We could not even be bothered to speak to the member of staff again. We were determined not to let it ruin the stay.
 
The following morning we went for a look around the hotel and went to have a coffee on the roof top terrace. Again another gorgeous area. However the place was deserted when the staff member eventually served us and we just asked for a coffee he could not have been more disinterested. We then proceeded to pay an extortionate amount for the smallest, most rubbish coffee in NYC.
 
We went downstairs and new staff were on duty. There was a lady who was very helpful and advised us about ‘The Know’ and some other things. None of which had been mentioned the night before. Later that day we returned to go and get a drink from ‘The Know’ app. We went back to the roof top bar and asked about how to get our drink. We were told we had 8 mins to get out drinks, two menus thrown on a table and then left. We got someone’s attention to order the drinks within the 8 mins, to be brought the most appalling cocktail I have ever seen and if I had been paying I would have refused. It simply cemented that we would spend no more money within the hotel.
 
The room and facilities are lovely. The bed is one of the most comfortable I have slept in. The bedding, robes products etc and all fantastic. The room layout is great. The view is fab. The service awful. It could not be further away from the service that Virgin pride themselves on. Very disappointed. Will definitely use Virgin again but not the hotel in NYC.

title: Horrible customer experience
text: Their customer service is about the worst I have ever experienced! I cancelled a reservation within the deadline. 7-8 weeks later, they decide to deduct my creditcard for the stay. No receipt, no warning and NO replied to any emails. I’ve tried for 3 weeks to get a response. And NOTHING!! Nothing near what you expect from a 4 star hotel. They will be expecting a letter from my lawyer shortly.

title: Great Hotel in a Great NYC Location
text:
Great stay so far at Virgin Hotel in NoMad.

Excellent location with proximity to Flatiron, Chelsea, NoMad and other popular areas of Manhattan as well as Penn Station (if arriving at JFK).

Cool, upbeat hotel with nice decor, 3rd floor restaurant with terrace, and 4th floor pool--all with Instagram pic access to the Empire State Building. Nice, friendly staff.

The rooms are fairly large for Manhattan and I really like the layout--separate toilet room and separate rain shower room not visible from the sleeping area. I am a Know member and got upgraded to a high floor Empire Chamber room with great views.

Would definitely return here again.

title: Great Stay - 4 Night Midtown Stay Seeing The Sights
text: My first NY visit. Cool hotel  with the best high  room views of The Empire State Building. Great location Midtown for either walking, subway or bus travel. Loved the bar, terrace and outdoor pool. A new hotel. Had a 29th floor 2x double bed room which was great with City views to die for. Take your earplugs as NY is never quiet. Thanks to all at Virgin Hotel for a great stay.

title: Nicely located but beware the spurious "Destination Fee" levied in addition by this hotel!
text: We stayed here for five nights at the end of August into early September as part of a short vacation to New York City. Overall the hotel is well-located, our room was clean and we enjoyed the very pleasant bar area. However, the visit was soured by the hotel levying a spurious "destination fee" of $35/night + tax to our bill (so $200 in total). I enquired what this was and the lady serving me suggested that it is like a 'city tax' or such-like levied by hotels around the world. I did some research afterwards and it is nothing of the sort - it's just an additional charge going to the hotel. If they want to charge this, then they at least need to be honest about what it is. Moreover, it would also be good for them to offer something in return.  In particular, the hotel should offer guests departing on evening flights back to Europe the opportunity to have a shower and refresh before departing the city. This is currently not possible in this hotel which is disappointing. In addition, and a smaller point all things considered, I would encourage the hotel to include a small kettle in rooms so guests wanting a cup of tea can boil water. I know that the Nespresso-type machines in the room can boil water but when you do this for tea, it comes out with a horrible coffee after-taste.

title: Great hotel-will be back!
text:
This hotel is fairly new and you can tell!

The rooms are nice and modern with everything you would want and need-fridge etc!

Staff are helpful. There is a really nice pool which we couldn't use as the weekend was a wash-out! Everdene is a lovely bar and they have a great happy hour!

We had a great view of the Empire State from our room which is 5 mins walk.

The subway station is just a few mins walk and it's located in a good part of Midtown.

The beds were so comfortable we are dreaming of the pillows!

They will be opening a spa in 2024 and a rooftop bar. I imagine this hotel will get really busy in the summer months.

Will recommend and come back to stay!

title: PLEASE READ REVIEWS- YOU WILL LOSE MONEY!
text: The mistake I made was not taking the reviews seriously - you will lose money here. I checked out - was told I didn’t have anything to pay as was correct. We didn’t use the mini bar - but I have been charged nearly £60 for things we didn’t have. The hold that was charged on arrival hasn’t been released over a week and a half after we left so I’m nearly £400 out of pocket! It’s soured our holiday / despite Todd the manager saying he would look into it - he is now choosing to ignore my emails

title: Pubes in shower
text: Terrible, staff incompetent and seemingly no manager on-site to speak to. Checked in and put in a room, realised after a while the room had not been cleaned, pubes in shower, hairs in bed and both rubbish bins still full. Told they’d refund me an amenities cost which I wasn’t due to pay anyways as was included in my price through Booking.com - nice view but very disappointing experience and am here all week!
