title: Dirty room with blood, employees stealing from your bags
text:
Traveling for work, I have to stay at this hotel twice a month. Checked in dirty room with blood, hair everywhere. Don't leave your belongings to the hotel unless you have a lock. An employee stole twice from my bag that I left there while waiting for check in. 
Todd the « VP » who replies to reviews telling he will investigate to solve the issue, will never get back to you. Or he must be doing a very serious investigation for 2 months now!

title: Good base and amazing vibe
text:
Hotel has all the basics covered to a high a standard. It’s a good base and much better than the nearby hotels and Hilton for similar price. 

The restaurant, pool and bar have an amazing vibe, great spaces to hang out to add something a bit extra.

Rooms are good quality but smaller than I expected, you walk through the bathroom to reach the bed. 

Upper floor rooms with an Empire view are worth the extra but the mini bar and prices are not - there’s plenty stores nearby selling the same food and drink for much less.

title: Dishonest/Bad Customer Service
text: I was very excited to finally stay in the Virgin Hotel on Broadway in NYC with my close friend who frequents this hotel and raves about it. Sadly due to her work, we had to cancel this visit and were waiting to rebook. As per hotel policy, I expected to lose my first night's stay as part of the cancellation policy. However after contacting the hotel, emails, calls, and repeated emails regarding the remainder of my refund (which was told was on the way), I eventually stopped receiving any replies, and no refund was ever issued(May-Aug w/ no results). One person was wonderful and helpful on the phone but had to push the issue to a higher personal, and then it all went downhill. Hope to warn others about the potential issues that may arise if booking with this hotel.

title: It’s all in the details - or lack of
text:
The positives - great midtown location, little street noise, great bar with live music some days and great restaurant with friendly staff.  Suite was spacious.

The negatives - aircon on low was still super noisy, problem with faulty light in bedroom that kept flashing, and then would not turn off and took half an hour at night when I wanted to go to bed to get maintenance to reset the switch.  Housekeeping - floors not swept or vacuumed in the 5 days I was here and rubbish under the sofa.  Promised a credit on bill and became a headache to get them to put it on.  
Furnishings are cheap quality and while ok condition now will deteriorate quickly.  Would not stay here or any Virgin Hotel again as feel it’s all hype but not the follow through.

title: limited housekeeping for a 4 or 5 star hotel, Terrible
text:
we checked in early in the mrng at 7am, our room is not ready (thats's fine). at 3pm++ we came back, our room is not ready, they gave us a low-floor room, very NOISY.
next day, we came back to our room after lunch, beds were made BUT basin/sink was still dirty and trash was not empty. 
We were then told limited housekeeping only; so every other day ONLY they do "deep cleaning". 
We went down as we were going out again, to ask to be empty the trashbin and clean basin, the lady said she will ask to do so.
We came back 3-4 hours later, and nothing was done. 
TERRIBLE!!

title: Virgin Hotel on Broadway does not live up to the Branson brand.
text: My sister and I were so excited to spend time at the Virgin on Broadway, a gift from my husband and mini-vaca as we are native New Yorkers.  The rooms are beautiful, well appointed, with stunning views of the city.  Having said that, we’re big travelers and this is, by far, the worst hotel experience we’ve ever had.  The sheets/pillows were disappointing for such a caliber hotel.  That is the least of it.  The staff is inexperienced at best and downright rude and unprofessional.  My sister forgot her shoes by the foot of the bed and realizing this, we called to ask that they be put aside so we could return and retrieve them.  No efforts were made to communicate with housekeeping to resolve as we were consistently told that the supervising housekeeper said, “nothing has been turned in”.  Over the following days, multiple calls and efforts have reaped no result.  Not only were the shoes not put aside, we were erroneously charged for minibar usage that never happened.  This was never discussed/addressed at checkout so we could correct.  The manager, offered to “waive” the false charges as a “courtesy” for the now-gone shoes.  This hotel leaves much be desired.  New York has so much better and more to offer.  Go elsewhere.

title: Perfect hotel
text: The entire experience was simply amazing, the staff was extremely polite, make sure to ask for Darnell at the reception, he will make your experience even better. The room had an empire state building, and the restaurant is top notch. The gym and pool are perfect as well. Would recommend 10/10 :)

title: Great hotel in fantastic location.
text: Great hotel - amazing views, trendy atmosphere and location in midtown perfect for a first time family visit to NYC. Employees were really friendly and always helpful. Rooms were spacious, quiet and beds huge and so comfy! Only thing to note that would have been helpful to know in advance was that the ‘breakfast included rate’ actually is a $25 credit per person and gets a bit complicated with the breakfast choices. Also Spirit Hour was great (4-5pm) but clarity on time and what’s included (just one drink) would also have been helpful to know on arrival. Had a few errors when it came to the bill but Giulianna sorted it out quickly without any bother. Will be back!

title: Five star
text: The best experience and customer service!! The staff went above and beyond! The Bus Boy was so wonderful and greeted us each day. Klawson and Darnell were hands down so happy to explain things and give awesome recommendations to Little Italy. The Hotel rooms have more than you need!! The best beds with views! Only negative thing - we had to leave. Frank and Marisa G!!

title: Great service: sleek modern touch.
text: The service was excellent.  Klawson and Darnell were outgoing, helpful and an all around good people. Highly recommend!   Hotel finishes are sleek and modern: the rooms are bright and have excellent views of NOMAD.

title: Not up to Virgin standards
text:
Location: the hotel is in the kind of neighborhood you DO NOT go walking in! 
When we pulled up to the front door it looked more  like a cheap record store, not a hotel. 
Room: a floor plan that does not work; when you shower it is hard to access your towel with out getting the towel soaking wet. I put the bathrobe right outside the shower on the floor to be able to grab it. Well… the robe brushed up against the bottom of the shower door which was disgustingly dirty with reddish slimy gunk. 
The sliding door was inoperable, the lighting at the bathroom mirror did not work.
Service: check in service was a B-. 
The only good thing: the beds were comfortable.

title: Such a great hotel!
text: This hotel did not disappoint. Darnell and Jenny at the front desk were particularly helpful with helping out with plans in the city. They were amazing and I’m lucky to have met them. This hotel is so clean and comfortable. Can’t wait to stay here again:)

title: The Only Place to Stay in NYC!
text:
I don't even know where to begin - our stay at Virgin Hotels in NYC was beyond what I could have hoped for. I knew my bachelorette weekend was going to be amazing when we were greeted by Darnell. It was a breeze to check in and he was so lovely to speak to. Upon entering our room we were greeted with champagne & fruits because they knew it was my bachelorette - talk about making a girl feel special.

Every single amenity was amazing - from the pool, to the bar, to the nightclub...you really shouldn't skip out on any of it. The rooms themselves were stunning - the layout is perfect for a friends/family getaway and there was a stunning view wherever you looked out.

I can't say enough good things about Virgin Hotels & the amazing team - specifically Darnell, Chris, & Jenny. Thank you so much for making my bachelorette trip a dream come true! I can't wait to come back!

title: A truly exceptional stay! Our group's experience at the Virgin Hotel surpassed all expectations!
text:
I'd easily rate our stay at the Virgin NoMads Hotel more than 5 stars if I could!

Right as we entered the hotel, Darnell at the front desk warmly welcomed and, efficiently handled our early check-in. We came for bachelorette getaway and it was instantly elevated when we entered our rooms to find a stunning fruit platter, macaroons, and champagne, ideal for celebrating the bride-to-be. The handwritten card added a perfect finishing touch.

Positioned on the 19th and 21st floors, our rooms offered breathtaking morning views of the Empire State Building and city skyline. The thoughtful room layout met our group's needs, with sliding doors between the beds and bathroom area, it allowed our early risers to prepare quietly without disturbing our group still sleeping. Mini fridges were a convenient addition for treats, and the cleaning and room service teams were exceptional, ensuring pristine rooms and providing essentials like towels and toothbrushes.

Our pool club experience took our trip from good to exceptional. The relaxing poolside ambiance made us feel transported to a tropical resort. It was a unanimous highlight of the weekend.

On our last night, we explored the Everdene, the nightclub on the 3rd floor, and were pleasantly surprised. The music was top40/ R&B/ throwbacks which was just the vibe we were looking for! The indoor/outdoor options were fantastic with the dancefloor and balcony. The drinks were delicious and we were seamlessly able to charge everything to our room. Everdene is a must-visit for anyone in New York.

In terms of the hotel location, we were steps from the subway, with easy access to incredible food in Koreatown, charming cafes, bars, and top-notch pizza spots. Entertainment, great food, and transit were all within reach.

In conclusion, I wholeheartedly recommend the Virgin Hotel for a fun and relaxing stay in New York. It's a true gem! A special thanks to Darnell, Chris and Jenny who really went above and beyond for us.

title: Great stay at the Virgin New York
text:
We had a really nice time staying at the Virgin new york. Management and front desk are extremely friendly. The hotel is very new, clean and modern. Beds and pillows were very comfortable. Shower is good and the pool is a great add on option. Location in my opinion is great because it's close, but far enough away from times square. Also, close to the subway and lower Manhattan.
Great stay, would come back and would recommend.

title: Poor nights of sleep
text:
Loud alarms keep going off repeatedly. 

It’s past 2 am and the entire hotel woke up with an incessant alarm going for a solid 10 mins. Then the hotel mgmt decides to repeatedly state it was a false alarm even louder into the speakers. At the wee hours of the night mid week!!! Then another 10 mins. They get on the loud speaker to wake the entire hotel up again. At 2:34am!!!!!!

This is the 2nd time in a week!!! This is the Worst experience ever. What in the world is going on here?!

title: Best of NYC
text: Amazing service, perfect location, rooftop pool and bar views with the Empire State Building was phenomenal during anytime of the day!! The special touches the hotel added to make our stay unique was unforgettable. Thank you and can’t wait to be back!

title: Memorable Trip to NY
text: Stayed here with my two teenage boys for a special trip. We were greeted with a beautiful celebration food platter organised by Bethany. The lifts, despite other comments were great never had a problem with them. Visited the bar one night with boys and it was very pleasant however when we went another night it seemed geared more to adults and was very busy and so didn’t stay for a drink.  The location is great and loved the opening windows in the rooms. Liked the separate dressing room area as allowed me to have an early morning jet lag coffee without waking the teenagers!   All staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful, in particular Bethany who was exceptionally obliging and provided good customer service.  My only issue with the hotel was that we had bought commemorative cups from a Yankees match and from Funny Girl show that were no where near a rubbish bin but were removed (thrown away?) when we returned one day, much to the disappointment of my sons, despite raising this with staff immediately they were unfortunately never retrieved.

title: FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE - FROM A TRUE NEW YORKER!
text: So last weekend, I decided on a last-min staycay in the city (we live across the river in Brooklyn!) for my daughter and dog. Despite being a demanding New Yorker, we had no expectations about this new hotel, but the location was perfection so I booked without much thought. We were literally BLOWN AWAY with the incredible service. The check-in experience was outstanding - shout out to DIANA - who I hope checks you all in. What an amazing ambassador. The pool's stunning, the food is delicious, and the view from our room was classic NYC.  They even supplied an overstuffed dog bed and doggy bowl for my pampered toy poodle. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. Thank you for a wonderful experience, Virgin Hotels.  We'll be back. Likely every weekend!

title: Wonderful location. Nice rooms. Service so and so.
text: Pros: the view from the rooms is amazing. From the pool too. It's happy and modern. Contros: our phone did not work I informed the reception who sent 3 technicians without fixing the problem and they just forgot about it. I also complained because after cleaning they forgot the door completely open for hours and wet rugs on the floor. When we informed the front desk they just said they were sorry. So ..  for the price we paid I didn't find service at an acceptable level at all.

title: Great location, service & hospitality.
text: The hotel is new and located in the heart of New York. It has a great restaurant, rooftop lounge and bar, outdoor pool area, and very clean. The room was spacious, clean & comfortable. Carla and Matt really tried and made our stay amazing. Thank you so much and we definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

title: First time in NYC with kids. Virgin Hotel was the perfect base.
text:
Stayed for 5 nights in August with the family on vacation and couldn’t have been happier here. First things first… the views and location! Away from the madness of Times Sq but close enough for all the touristy stuff if you want. Beautifully set against the back drop of the Empire State Building. (See the photos!) The area was safe and good to walk around and lots of very nice restaurants and eateries nearby. 

The hotel team were lovely and helpful and the whole place had a very ‘cool’ vibe without being intimidating. Very happy with the service. 

The room felt relatively spacious for four of us considering this is NYC. The layout of the separate dressing areas, toilet closet and shower cubicle is a clever design. 

The massive bonus for us travelling with kids in the heat of August was the rooftop swimming pool. Not a huge pool but perfect for a cooling dip after a day travelling the hot city. It did get busy with guests at times but we always managed to find a lounger. 

I’ve read some reviews saying they had problems with the lifts / elevators. Wasn’t an issue for us, in fact the lifts were incredibly efficient. Just tap your room card and it automatically calls a lift to one of their 30 or so floors. Never had to wait more than a few seconds. 

We had a breakfast inclusive rate and the food in their restaurant Everdene was excellent. All the breakfast is a la carte and cooked to order…. Pancakes, waffles, eggs you name it. Felt like a real luxury to have a proper sit down breakfast everyday rather than a buffet. 

There was some confusion on how the breakfast rate worked and what was / wasn’t included but this was quickly sorted by the reception team. 

So overall a strong ‘yes’ recommendation from me for this hotel. If you are going to NYC and looking for modern luxury, a relaxed but cool atmosphere and well located then this could be for you!

title: A perfect stay in NYC
text: We has been welcoming at the front desk by Klawson. A real gentleman, professional, efficient and pleasant. The hotel was very clean. The room was very nice especially the one with a view on the Empire State Building. The pool and pool bar were very cool. Good emplacement.

title: new favorite hotel in nyc
text:
As soon as I walked in to checkin, it started with a fun and personable greeting by Klausan, he organically knows how to deliver amazing service and give unique recommendations that are memorable! The rooms are spacious and airy with natural light and fun touches throughout the room. 
I was able to enjoy all the amenities including the pool (chairs are first come first serve so be prepared) 
It’s a nice small oasis while being situated in the middle of the city.
Their restaurant, Everdene, was also quite yummy for breakfast before starting my workout. Again, a fun contemporary airy space by all glass and high ceilings.
The gym is also good, you get the essentials, but also spacious compared to most hotel gyms. 
Didi and Jonthan were also amazing by their friendly service and help while at checkout. No one falls short with attention to detail. Thank you to the team for making my time extra special while staying at Virgin Hotel.

title: Awesome
text: I went with my husband for the first time and was greeted with an amazing welcome and great smile. Jeannette was amazing to us she gave us an upgrade and told us about a few places to visit in the city. She was great, the restaurant was also very very good and the rooms are beautiful and clean. We’ll be back again for sure.

title: Thank you Kelsey !
text:
Thank you Kelsey !! We had such a great time thanks to you.

We arrived very tired at 1am and even very late you were very kind.

I really recommend this hotel.
The view is amazing.
Staff is very friendly.

title: Great position, great vibes
text:
Spent three nights @ this hotel 
It was super clean and the room had the best room over the Empire State Building. The room has quite an unusual layout but it's very enjoyable and it is a very spacious room for Manhattan standards. 
It is a great hotel to stay at in summertime as it has several enjoyable outdoor areas (pool area - always found beds there, I have been lucky cause there aren't many - and a third floor balcony area), all of them with an amazing view over the Empire  

Everyone at the lobby was way nice. It was overall a very good stay

I just wish they add details to the hotel cause it can have a lot of personality, it just needs a little extra color on the walls (and mirrors in the elevators!)

title: Amazing hotel with a beautiful view of the empire state building from the pool
text: Amazing hotel, pool with a beautiful view over the empire state building. Employees are very friendly, the room is new, clean and modern. Everything is there. The placement of the hotel is also perfect! Within 15 minutes you are at times Square, multiple supermarkets and restaurants nearby just like the metro system.

title: Best nights sleep at a clean and comfortable and fun filled hotel
text: I enjoyed my stay at Virgin Hotel NYC. I came to NYC for a conference and liked the location, close enough to restaurants and public transportation but not too busy or crowded.  The bed and pillows were extremally comfortable. The view was spectacular and the room was very clean. I like that there was a door dividing the bathroom/shower area so that my husband could get ready earlier than me and not disturb my sleep. The food in Everdeen was scrumptious and the service was fantastic. The night life on the terrace nightly was so fun and lively. The hotel offered so much for the price I paid. Did I mention that there was a pool and lovely deck to relax on? I will be staying at more Virgin Hotels in the future especially since the bed was so very comfortable and I woke up feeling refreshed.  PS my friends stayed at another large chain and complained about how uncomfortable their beds were. Glad I chose Virgin for my stay!

title: Wonderful Customer Service
text: We knew we were staying at a beautiful hotel with amazing amenities, but what really topped our experience was the customer service. When we arrived, Klawson greeted us with warmth and so much humor. He was very professional, but also personal. We chatted about our anniversaries (it’s our 10th one we’re celebrating here at the hotel - which Virgin upped our experience with a beautiful room upgrade!) - and we just completely enjoyed our conversation with him! He made check in so smooth and fun, and our 10th wedding anniversary is off to an incredible start here. We couldn’t be happier! Thank you Klawson and Virgin hotel team!

title: Oasis and home in the concrete jungle of Manhattan
text: In the metallic and giant concrete jungle of Manhattan, you really want to escape as soon as your business meeting is over and your goals are reached.  The lush and posh extravagant elements as well as the down to earth hospitality by the staff, make you feel so at ease and at home.  The linen and bed sheets were neatly pressed just like the uniforms of the staff when I was staying here with my friends in Jul. And because it was just opened, you could smell the freshness in everything, from your room furniture to the lobby carpet ! And even John Lam and Candice Cancino would personally greet you with wonderful smiles if you bump into them ! Yes, you didn’t know who they were first, until your friends told you they were the partner and GM of this Hotel. It was courtesy , professionalism and total quality control  from top down as in Total Quality Control! And you will always be the center of service attention at this center of Manhattan hotel location !

title: Good location but weak restaurant and service
text: We’re staying 6 nights in this hotel. The location is great, the room is ok but unfortunately the restaurant is really NOT on the level where it should be. Mainly, there is nothing for kids. Not for breakfast, nor for dinner. Waiting time at breakfast was 30 min. Tea came after the food, thus water was the main drink at breakfast. We will continue to enjoy the city, appreciate the great location but the bar and restaurant won’t be ours anymore.

title: Theft from Room and lack of acknowledgement and support from hotel management
text:
Stayed at the hotel I. July and our room was entered without permission and suitcase and belonging stolen, despite assurances from hotel we still 5 weeks later are no further forward in getting an explanation as to what happened or compensation for the loss. We have to continuously try and contact hotel, always getting the same response they are waiting on insurance. No response from experience manage or general manager. To date it has cost us £100 in international calls with no resolution. Extremely poor security as floor needs keycard entry for elevator and key card entry for room so in order for the theft to happen had to have someone who worked at the hotel involved or at fault, lack of support at time of theft, we had to push for police to be called and lack of follow up as we have to chase constantly for updates and are getting nowhere.
This was not a case of not talking necessary action to secure valuable goods, this was someone entering our room, and leaving with an extra large suitcase full of clothes.
For a new hotel, security measures are poor but customer service is awful ! I wouldn’t recommend staying here unless you want to have your belongings with you at all times

title: Perfect Stay
text: What a great experience we had. We stayed there for 6 nights the week of the 4th of July. The entire staff was so helpful and friendly. Everyone from the frontdesk, bell staff, security, housekeeping, and everyone at the Everdene restaurant that waited on us. Great room with incredible views of the Empire State Building and the Chrysler building. Even the pool area had stunning views. We ate breakfast every morning at Everdene, and the food was delicious.  Seeing the Macy’s 4th of July fireworks from the rooftop, then later from, our room in the shadow of the Empire State Building all lit up in Red, White, and Blue…it doesn’t get any better than that. On the day we checked out, I can honestly say that we were sad to leave.

title: Fantastic
text: I’m still in awe of what a gem I stumbled across with booking this hotel. We had a great deal and just a base level room which still had the most stunning views of the Empire State Building. The location was absolutely perfect- central to everything we wanted to do. Staff was all very helpful and bartenders/waitstaff especially wonderful. The pool and bar/restaurants have great views and aesthetics and obviously get busy. Highly recommended.

title: Just a hard no
text: This one is a hard no from me. While all hotels may experience glitches, as this one did, from non working room outlets, to out of order ice and water dispensers, to sometimes non functioning elevator card readers to rooms not ready when promised…I could go on, it seemed it was a constant stream of issues, all issues can be resolved with a professional and polite staff. With the exception of two employees, one porter and one bellman, all were downright nasty. In addition, the hotel refused to honor the room rate quoted when I booked in. With so many hotels in NY why choose one without customer service.

title: Virgin rents the pool out for private events.
text:
Do not come to this hotel for the pool. They will happily lawsuit for private events and quick guests out .

It must happen often, because when I complain to the staff, they told me “ we have to rent the space for private events. What can we do?”. 

Unbelievable…. If I had known this, I would not have this hotel in the middle east of super hot July.

title: Tries to be something it’s not
text:
This hotel is ok but service and experience is far from what it’s trying to be. 
First off, amenity charges are a scam. But we know many hotels in NYC and Vegas started charging them. At least some hotels have the decency to have a wine hour or something. Not the virgin. 

The rooms are spacious for NYC but the AC isn’t working right. We had the room on 65 and it felt like 71. 

Breakfast was so hit or miss. The salmon bagel plate for $19 is good value for money. The not so virgin breakfast should be $5 at the best. What a sorry breakfast. 

Service is very slow and the elevators are a nightmare. 
On the plus side, the location is unbeatable. 
Oh I noticed they charge $16 for a virgin cocktail. A bit crazy if you ask me.

title: Can’t cancel
text:
Booked for a family of 4 for a week. Unfortunately needed to cancel and wrote to them on four separate occasions to confirm cancellation. Not once did they respond, I checked it was the correct email address.

First night of the now cancelled holiday what happens? You guessed it, almost $500 taken from my account. 

Judging by the other reviews and people’s recent experiences booking here is quite a gamble.

title: Unreliable hotel
text:
A great hotel with many possibilities but our stay was a total disappointment.
They kept the amount of 700 euro as insurarance for our stay, I couldn’t  figure out what they charged us, but  the amount of 300 euro that should return us they never did until now. The worst part is that I said them 3 email asking what is going to happened with the 300 euro and no one ever replied!
Very unreliable hotel in every aspect!
The check in day was 18 of May 2023 and the check out 25 of May. My name evangelia Michaloglou.

title: Great stay in this new hotel - any teething problems dealt with efficiently by super staff.
text:
Great stay in this new hotel - some teething problems that the staff sorted out efficiently and politely.

Fantastic location. Great room (love the sliding door to dressing room concept, plenty of storage). Very comfy bed. Super view of Empire State. 

We booked with Virgin Holidays and had a $25 ppn breakfast deal included with our rate. Everything we ate at breakfast was delicious and the restaurant surroundings (both inside and out on the terrace) were beautiful.  Staff and service level was exceptional. 

Pool was small and pretty crowded - but it’s a rooftop pool in New York!! 

I picked up major errors on the bill the day prior to checking out but a call to guest services had someone on the case to rectify it that evening. 

Clearly they have some problems with the ice machines - the one on our floor was not functional during our stay but staff delivered ice when we asked for it. 

Smeg mini fridge - fits the aesthetic, but SO noisy. We unplugged it during the night.

All in, a great stay. Staff were fantastic in sorting any problems - which I am sure they will iron out with time. Highly recommend.

title: Beware many additional costs.  Quick to charge slow to refund
text:
I booked this hotel as I thought as part of the Virgin brand there would be transparency and value for money but I am unconvinced.

The room was spacious enough, especially for a solo traveller, with good technology and room facilities.  My room, although advised was ready on checking in - had maintenance taking place when i arrived.  Room was only serviced once in three days but on raising this with the reception team was rectified for my final day (3 day stay)

The most concerning matter to me was what I believe are hidden costs and charging approaches.  On check in I was advised each room booked needed a charge of $300 added in case of damage.  This would be refunded (in due course). A charge not insignificant when booking multiple rooms and the UK bank approach is to deduct initially rather than pend payment  I was also informed there was an amenity charge of $35 per day per room to cover the gym and pool (whether used or not).  I cannot find this charge being identified in the charges to be paid.  Again an additional cost along with all the usual US taxes.  

Overall, expensive given the unadvertised hidden charges.

title: Nothing works right and they’re all mean
text:
We were offered a discount at booking but didn’t actually receive it when we checked out. Because of issues with this hotel (outlets didn’t work, elevators broke, water machine was broken on our floor, one of our rooms wasn’t ready at check-in time) and the general indifference/ incompetence/rudeness of half the staff, we would not have extended our stay an extra night if we didn’t think the we’d be getting the rate we were quoted at booking. Not a very good experience. For the same price you can find much better hotels in New York. 

(Also the staff yelled at me a lot. One lady got mad when I tried to use the broken elevator. A housekeeper was mad that I had the wrong color light on my door (???). I hated being here and I couldn’t wait to leave!)

I’m giving it an extra star for the view of the Empire State Building.

title: Incredible views!
text: Beautifully designed and decorated hotel, modern sleek finish with factory/warehouse style decor. Recently opened in NYC.  Fantastic utilisation of the space and large room compared to what you may expect in NYC - twice the size of the previous hotel we were at so it was well received by us! Stayed here for 2 nights, although tried to book it for longer but it was unavailable. Came from another hotel chain to the Virgin for the last 2 days of our week long stay and it was a welcome change. The views from the twin chamber we were given on the 17th floor was stunning! The facilities were great, pool and roof top bar on the 4th floor with great views of the Empire State. Jessie was super friendly and really took the time out to show us around. Thank you for the most wonderful stay! Beds were super comfy, but the pillows could be much better. They are filled with hollow fibre, instead of down and had seen better days. Staff are wonderful. Didn't use the restaurant or bar but everything else was great and highly recommend if you're planning on visiting NYC. Close to all amenities, perfect walking distance to plenty of sites and restaurants. Around the corner from Madison Sq and plenty of subway stations to get you around the rest of NY. Thanks Virgin for a wonderful stay and Bethany and the team for taking such good care of us!

title: Atendimento ruim !
text:
Quando chegamos ao hotel altas horas para checkin o atendente super chato, sem empatia alguma. Processo demorado já no começo. 
Quarto foi o suficiente para nós, mas a limpeza pecou muito. 
Piscina sempre lotada vc não tem onde sentar. Não voltaria tem outros hotéis melhores.

title: Best hotel ever!
text: I highly recommend this hotel for anyone who visits New York. Its prime location is walkable to all the nicest restaurants and attractions. The views from the hotel room are amazing. The beds are the most comfortable I’ve ever slept in. Had so much fun eating by the pool and the drag brunch was so funny. Definitely will come back here again. Best hotel ever!

title: Yes, it’s great!
text:
First trip to NYC and after travelling with Virgin Atlantic on holidays to California we thought we’d give their package deals a go. A nice real human being at the Virgin call centre sorted us out and we flew Virgin (via Delta partner) to JFK and stayed a week at their new, New York hotel.

It had only been open a few months so there were some minor staff issues as everyone gets up to speed but special mention goes out to Jenny on reception who dealt with a couple of minor issues and a billing confusions expertly, professionally and with great warmth and character - what a difference it makes. 

Thanks to her and her colleagues I’d go back.

Rooms are clean, comfortable (the big, mirrored sliding-door between the bedroom and bathroom area means you can get organised without disturbing your still sleeping partner!) and the views are spectacular- you can almost reach out and touch the Empire State Building (not really but it’s very close.) 

Once you get the hang of using the lifts it’s an easy experience navigating the hotel - the well equipped gym is brand new (July 2023) the Everdene restaurant inside-outside bar is nice. The outside pool area, although smallish is fine for recovering in after New York has had its way with you - lots of towels and a nice bar area. You’re also surround by the skyscrapers which is a cool experience.

If you do the breakfast take the stone filter coffee rather than cappuccino etc as you get free refills (July 2023.)

You’re based in an upcoming area so the surrounding streets aren’t  super- posh (yet) but you’re in walking distance of everywhere you want to go (go for a walk on the high line 10mins away - you won’t regret it.)

All in all a good experience at the Virgin New York and I can be quite fussy….

title: Great location and lovely pool area
text:
We loved our stay at this new(ish) hotel in NoMad.

The rooms are large by NYC standards, and we loved that the sleeping area had a pocket door to separate it from the dressing area.  This allows one member of the family to quietly leave for morning meetings without disturbing the rest of the sleeping family as well as providing a space for the adults to hangout when the kids are sleeping at night.

We would have loved to see some hooks on the walls but the closet space was ample and the separate shower and toilet rooms were appreciated.

The smeg fridge was full of minibar offerings which we had to move around to bring leftovers back and store cold water.  We were unable to get the water and ice machine down the hall to work until our last night but I assume that was user error and it's  a nice thing to offer guests so as to avoid all the single use plastic bottles.

We ordered room service and the food was good, albeit pricey, but what we expected for room service in NYC.

The two main selling points for this hotel are location (a 20 minute walk to basically everything) and the pool.  The pool is a delight and was well used by our daughter.

All in all, a great stay and we will be back for sure.

title: Our new home away from home!
text:
Our experience at the Virgin hotel in New York City was absolutely amazing!  The location is perfect and close to many great restaurants and shops.  Bryant park is a few minute walk from the hotel.  The room was perfect, the view was breathtaking and the staff was incredible.  The bed was so comfortable.  We loved the shower and the movie star sit down vanity area.  We really appreciated the touchless elevator system.  It is the perfect combination of class, style and comfort.  It is our new home away from home.  We can't wait to come back!

Brian & Pamela 
South Florida

title: The Virgin NY is a Mess
text: This hotel is a mess. The rooms could be great but they aren't because the bedding is cheap and torn already (they have only been open a few months), and the showers are really moldy. Making everything worse is the disoriented staff. I was told at booking that the amenity fee covered bottled water in the room and access to the pool but then when there wasn't any bottled water in the room and the pool was closed I was told it was a NYC law to charge an amenity fee (it isn't!). I was then told that I would not be charged an amenity fee. Then I was charged twice. I have called the hotel 3 times, replied to the experience manager, and emailed them and no one replies. I suggest staying somewhere else.

title: Amazing experience!
text:
The Virgin Hotel is beautifully done. I love all the aesthetics. The staff was so hospitable, always checked in with me, and made sure my stay was perfect. The food was tasty, had variety, and yummy! It was also the perfect place to co-work! 

I can’t wait for the spa to open up! I’m super excited and will be back! 

10/10 recommend!

title: WOW.  VIRGIN HOTEL FLATIRON IS HIP, FUN AND FAMILY FRIENDLY!!!!!
text: What a wondeful family friendly hotel!  Candice Cancino runs an amazing team.  Everyone at the front desk was gorgeous and hip and friendly.  Bellman were friendly and super helpful.  as was security with all our family packages and deliveries.   We live in Manhattan but have been renovating our new home flatiron for the past year and a half.  We came back in from our summer home with our entire family in tow.  2 toddlers and my wife and me.  Like most families, we are a handful.  Deliveries from Costco so we can save on groceries to bring back to Montauk, where groceries cost 3-4 times the price.   Hand delivered microgreens from Union Square.  Fedex packages that we needed to be picked up.  As a former hotel owner (pre-Covid, thank god!), i was truly impressed.  1) It's not easy to open a new hotel as complex and large as Virgin Hotel NYC Flatiron.  2) It's not easy to get a large staff that's new to work together seamlessly.  Candice has done that.  Bravo.  Also, the pool club manager.  Wow.  We call him Rico Suave.  He took care to make sure that we entertained our 3 year and 1 year old daughters who LOVE him and the pool.  The breakfast was amazing and my wife and daughters were dancing while eating to the cool vibe and music.  Thanks also to Bethany Cohen, who made sure everything went smoothly.   Our new home is only a few blocks from the hotel but we will be enjoying this new addition to FLATIRON frequently  and my wife and I would highly recommend this gem to all our friends.

title: It's a no from me
text:
Loved the design of this hotel, from the minute you walk into the hallway it's mesmerising. Rooms are cleverly designed, spacious and with smart quirks like the built in seat in the bed frame, vestibule and more. 

Operationally, the property however is largely a car crash. Staff, at best, were unhelpful, disinterested and inhospitable. At worst, they were rude. The fitness centre AC was not operational over the two days I was there, making working out in 85F impossible. I had a similar unpleasant experience when I attempted to get dinner, where I was made to feel like I was burdening the host by just being there. I ended up leaving as the food options were uninspired. 

I hope the hotel is able to fix its staffing and operational issues as it really was quite stunning.

title: Almost perfect... almost!
text:
We were scheduled to check-in on a Friday but our flight was cancelled so I called the hotel and the person quickly and happily bumped our check-in date to Saturday.

We were assigned a room on the 24th floor and on the way to the hotel, we checked-in via the app. When we arrived, we were unable to use the elevator to get to our room so we returned to the front desk. Turns out there was a problem with access to the 24th floor so we were switched to  a room on the 23rd floor and given key cards. (The digital room key on the app was never updated.)

The room was clean (except for a few white stains on the seat next to the bed) and had a nice view of the Empire State Building. The mini-bar was not stocked with all the products listed on the card -- but it didn't matter because we would never pay $7 for a Coke or $8 for a bag of chips.

Our room was quiet (we only heard a bit of noise from a neighbour) and we loved how the toilet and the shower were separate. (There is a rainfall shower as well as a handheld nozzle with "gentle" and "who-needs-a-man" settings!) Our room was refreshed on the two days that we requested service.

We were so comfortable in the room that we asked if we could extend our stay by two days, which they happily did – at the same daily rate.

Some people posting reviews here have complained about the elevators but we found them easy to use and efficient. Others have noted the size of the pool but we thought it was sufficient for cooling off. 

What WAS striking was the lack of service on the 3rd and 4th floors.

We were ignored by the staff at the pool bar (our guess is that two average-looking men over 40 are not the hotel's desired demographic). We watched a server bring drinks and food to others on the pool deck but he never came near us. We got the message that we were not welcome and never went back to the pool.

It was the same attitude during the daily "spirit hour" on the outdoor terrace on the 3rd floor – we sat and enjoyed our cocktails but no one ever approached us to ask if we wanted another round or if we wanted to see a food menu.

The overall lack of service (and being made to feel unwelcome) meant that we chose not to eat any meals at the restaurant during our stay.

Speaking of lost revenue opportunities... we asked about purchasing Virgin Hotels baseball caps like the one we saw employees wearing and were told that the only merch available is the umbrella ($115).

Overall, we'd recommend this hotel for its location, rooms and amenities. Hopefully its employees can lose a bit of the attitude and start providing service to all guests, not just the young, pretty ones.

title: Rooms left open after cleaning. Decent other than that
text:
A nice hotel with poor customer service experience after our two rooms were both left open after cleaning one day, potentially for several hours before we returned. The concern was badly handled by the front desk manager. 

Other than that, a decent hotel. Rooms were a good size, great location for exploring, delicious breakfast.

title: Management and billing issues
text: Truly an unpleasant experience. Hotel is new and room was nice for New York standard and restaurent was beautiful, but lots of issues. First of all, they keep charging you all the time and it took days for charges to adjust, on check out lots of mistakes and I had to wait an hour for manager to come back from lunch to adjust. Pool was small and super busy with party both days we were there even though they told us it’s only got guests of hotel, clearly not. Worse than that, even though I voiced my concerns many times, no manager or supervisor reached out to me and I am a long term loyal virgin card holder.

title: Dårlig opplevelse
text: Vi valgte dette hotellet da de tilbød frokost inkludert i romprisen. Det vi ikke visste var at frokostpakken var på $25 pr person men det var ikke noe på deres frokost meny til $25. Dette medførte at vi måtte betale for frokost hverdag. Vi opplevde at både de som jobbet i restauranten og de i resepsjonen ikke visste noe som helst, de var lite hyggelige, sa forskjellige ting og var uhøflige. Anbefaler ikke dette hotellet.

title: Great location and views.
text:
We chose the Virgin Hotel in NYC mainly because of its location. Walking distance to major attractions with a subway station nearby; it's perfect for exploring. Upon entering everyone was friendly and Check-in was efficient.

The chamber room layout, is perfect for shared space with separate rooms for the shower and toilet. Loved the Virgin Red fridge. The way the space is configured might not be to everyone's liking, but worked for us. The view from the room of the Empire State Building was great with floor to ceiling windows. 

In the room there are a few buttons which let the team know if your room needs to be serviced or not. This wasn't explained to us, but we managed to figure it out.

The pool is small, so sometimes it can be hard to get a spot. After certain hours it is opened to the public.

I downloaded the Virgin Hotels App, allows you room controls. Also, I saw everyday an updated list with our fees. Very transparent and easy to follow how your final price sums up.

﻿﻿﻿The wifi speed was very good and easy to connect devices.
﻿﻿﻿

Overall our stay was enjoyable.

title: Não volto!!!
text:
Vou falar da minha estadia neste hotel: 

Serviço, péssimo, funcionários sem treinamento apropriado, poucos os que são simpáticos, durante dois dias seguidos não limparam e arrumaram meu quarto, precisei pedir, vieram e, não repuseram as toalhas, pedi room service, esqueceram os talheres, pedi no primeiro dia mais cabides, estou esperando até hoje…

Recepção, tratamento frio, seco e sem vontade de atender o cliente. Nada acolhedor. Um dia a chave do quarto não funcionou e, eu fui pedir uma nova, pediram documentos, número do cartão de crédito e foram super rudes, o recepcionista foi extremamente impaciente e grosso. No check out disseram que enviariam uma cópia da minha conta por e-mail, não mandaram.

Barulho, festa quase todos os dias, os quartos (como o meu) que ficava próximo da piscina simplesmente não tem sossego, o som muito alto só para quando chega a noite na área da posiciona nos dias de festa, aliás o hotel parece mais uma boate do que um hotel, sua preocupação é com as festas diárias. Eles precisam se decidir, entre serem um hotel ou uma boate.

Comida, horrível, poucas opções no room service, o café da manhã é medíocre, mesmo com o mais simples pedido de comida, eles falham, não conseguem entregar torradas quentes durante o café da manhã, vieram todos os dias frias.

Frigobar: do primeiro dia até o final, não repuseram as águas. 

Elevador, simplesmente fizeram um sistema que, não funciona, complicado, os elevadores não são inteligentes, você quer subir, ele muitas vezes desce primeiro pra te levar depois no seu andar superior. Você não tem a opção de apertar o seu andar, precisa ver no visor quem elevador vai te atender.

O sistema de comunicação é todo feito através da televisão, não existe um contato para os serviços a não ser pela TV, não preciso dizer que, não funciona na maioria das vezes, isso sem contar a irritação que é precisar falar com alguém e não ter ninguém para a comunicação.

 Em resumo, não recomendo, não volto e acho que com todos esses problemas o hotel só merece 3 estrelas e olhe lá.

title: Stay away
text: Read the bad reviews as well as the good. This hotel loves to overcharge, arrived and was  told that as we arrived late and didn’t advise them by email that our room had been canceled. I showed them the email I had sent to them, that said they don’t have it on record. Then I showed them the invoice that they had taken the $3800 Aud out of my account for the 5 night stay. The manager said we can still have another room but it will cost more money as we have to make a new booking and the room rate is now higher. Absolutely ridiculous.

title: Great views, spacious rooms
text:
Perfect location and spacious rooms by NYC hotel standards. Breakfast on the terrace is a great way to start the day — and perfect perch to get some work done.

Incredible views from many of the rooms, too. The only issue I had was trying to order room service on the TV but they resolved it quickly.

Front desk was also super helpful and welcoming at all hours of the day.

title: New hotel has to work out kinks
text:
I understand that this is a new hotel and some adjustments have to be made.  Here are my suggestions:
1 - I booked my room with you directly.  I'm not certain I got the best deal you had to offer.  You had a third night free program going, which I thought for a 6-day stay such as we had would be best.  I was told that my Mastercard discount was the best, but I think this was incorrect.  We should be able to trust advice from your own employees.
2 - Using the card reader for the elevators was most frustrating.  I watched many people go through this as well.  Either get a new system, or at least make the target for the card clearer, such as making it red.
3 - Room was cleaned only twice during our stay, despite the service light being on.
4 - Ice machine on our floor was impossible to operate.
5 - You really need to install towel racks.  Wet towels ended up on the floor and couldn't get dry for re-use.
6 - Pool hours should be much wider than 11-6.  Should be 8am - 8pm
7 - More hangars in closets

title: My new favorite NYC Hotel!!
text:
Absolutely loved staying in this new property! From check-in to check-out, the hotel staff went out of their way to welcome us and ensure that the stay was perfect!  Everyone was very enthusiastic…lots of good energy! 

Our room was beautiful with floor/ceiling windows that looked out over the city and a view of the Empire State Building! The windows even opened, which is a huge bonus for this “fresh air, love the city sounds” person! ☺️ But when closed, very soundproof! 

The room layout is perfect for shared space with separate rooms for the shower and toilet. Loved the Virgin Red fridge and shower.  

The rooftop bar was very comfy with lots of green space, as was the pool with the view of the Empire State Building! Beautiful! 

I’ve traveled to NYC my entire career and stayed in many hotels over the last 30 years.  I tend to spend hours trying to find a property that has spacious rooms, fun common space, good energy, great views, windows that open 😉, and nice staff reviews! Virgin Hotel NYC had it all and is definitely my new favorite in NYC!

title: The vibes are immaculate!
text:
The Virgin Hotel was the perfect hotel!! Amazing bellman team at checkin, beautiful unreal rooms, comfortable beds and a beautiful pool in the trendy nomad district. Run dont walk !!! 
But what really put it over the top was foie gras and martinis at Everdene their staple restaurant on the 3rd floor !!!! 

The vibes are immaculate!

title: Not Ready For Primetime
text:
The hotel was slammed with pride events and not at all prepared for the clown show that ended up happening. Very drunk folks passed out all over the hotel and mess everywhere. Super not cool.

Elevators are a joke. They work when they feel like it. I was stuck in a car going up twice. The Marriott Marquis uses a version of this system, but it's much more efficient.

Bartenders are overworked and they simply cannot keep up.

Gym never goes below 80 degrees and it's an uncomfortable sweatbox.

Windows in room and in common areas leak and there are air circulators everywhere to deal with it.

Lighting in room is hit or miss. Sketchy wiring makes some of them blink randomly.

Tile work in room showers was clearly laid quickly and without any skill.

This hotel may look good on the veneer, but not for long with the crowd they're attracting.

title: Lock your doors, they give your room keys to strangers
text: Still at the hotel until June 27th. The day I checked in, June 24th,  I decided to take a shower when all of the sudden I see the door open right in front of me. In this hotel the shower is right by the front door. I was shocked that someone was coming into my room when I was naked ready to take a shower. It was a couple, not the housekeeping staff. As soon as this happened I called the front desk and they apologized and that was that. I asked to talk to a manager as this was an unacceptable situation. I am still waiting for the manager to contact me. I stopped by the front desk this morning and asked to talk to the manager about what happened and was informed he/she dis not have time as he/she was in a meeting. Perfect! I asked if the manager could contact me. Left my email, I bet they have my phone from the reservation, and at least the manager could have left a voicemail in my room’s phone. None of the above happened. Two days and no manager communication. My guess is they don’t care. It was humiliating to be seen naked by total strangers and they don’t care. The hotel is OK, a clean place to stay in the city, but definitely not a four or five star hotel. The horrible level of service and lack of care is all I need to never come back. I bet the higher management in the Virgin organization would not like to be associated with this type of quality of service.

title: Sales Manager Extraordinaire!
text: This review is for the Sales Manager Melissa. Melissa went above and beyond to ensure our group was taken care of. Even in times of stress, she ensured me everything and everyone would be taken care of in the most calm manner. I really appreciate her attention to detail and kind demeanor. She didn’t need to bend backward for us and she totally did! Thank you Melissa, you showed my team and I the best customer experience!

title: Good location
text:
We chose the Virgin Hotel in NYC mainly because of its location which you cannot fault. With a subway station nearby it’s perfect for exploring all parts of the city. Check in was efficient. The rooms are a decent size due to the way the space is configured. It won’t be to everyone’s liking but worked for us. The view from the room was great with floor to ceiling windows. There isn’t a kettle and only a coffee machine. The fridge is trendy but noisy. We unplugged it at night. The room lighting is a little confusing. Housekeeping was hit and miss. We took breakfast in the 3rd floor restaurant which was excellent. Overall our stay was enjoyable.
On a separate issue I must point out that NYC, especially certain areas in midtown Manhattan, the smell of weed is everywhere unfortunately.

title: Super!!!!
text:
Tutto super !!!!
Dalla reception dove ho trovato Tracey all manager Faidonas…hotel super bello! Personale super disponibile e gentile …camere super pulite e identiche alle foto …piscina, bar, spazi nel rooftop tutto bellissimo …

title: Excellent service and location!
text: Excellent service and location. The food is very good! All mayor atractions in Manhattan are around 15 minutes away on metro or walking! The rooms are spacious and very confortable. The view to the Empire State is fenomenal!

title: Nice room Nice NYC view

title: Great design but terrible service
text:
We had a Staycation at this brand new hotel right across from my office in Nomad. Fabulous exciting design, but some misses. The barn style room doors are hard to operate, just one vanity chair and no shelf space in an oversight. The ice machine doesn’t work, the app doesn’t work and the elevator fob design is a complete failure. 

The waiter in the restaurant does not know how to open wine bottles, or to serve them before the meal arrives. The bar staff does nothing serve the bill, or the staff does not appear in time to take the order. 

We love our hometown and the design world, and are willing to overlook the poor service. But it will be hard to cut them slack all the time.  They need to train their staff and shape up quickly if they want to attract loyal customers. Both local residents and travelers.

title: Great hotel and experience
text:
We stayed beginning of June one week in the Virgin Hotel New York.
The overall experience was just perfect and I must say I don't understand some of these reviews here e.g. giving the hotel 1 star just because of the elevators. You go to the elevator and you either first choose your floor and than hold the card at the card reader or you do it the other way around. Than its tells you which elevator to pick. One of the first things they explained to us. The welcoming was very friendly. Nearly everytime we entered the lobby we were greated with a "Hi guys!". The rooms are spacious, especially for New York with great interieur and design. Beds are comfortable, as are the pillows. I registered before at their customer program "The Know" and we got a free room upgrade plus a bag with some chips and water and a handwritten greeting card delivered a few minutes after check-in. We also spend one afternoon at the pool which is not the biggest but with a great view on the skyline. The following stuff was not perfect but is nothing for which I would deduct a star in this review because all the rest was so perfect.

Not so good:
1. The fridge is fairly loud. We used to unplug it during the night, and the drinking was still very cold in the morning.
2. The mini bar is advertised as "street priced" but after asking for the price list I can say that's not correct. It's as expensive as in every other hotel
3. On the last two days the floor in the room was not cleaned. On check-out they gave us a discount of 3 days amenity fee
4. They have basically everyday some kind of event at the pool area, especially during pride month now. Sometimes it can be hard as customer to get a spot because of other people joining the event. But I understand that this is also because of the Virgin brand that they do there events.
5. We had no slippers in the room but also didn't need them

What I especially liked:
1. With "The know" App I saw everyday an updated list with our fees and what we bought inside the hotel. Very transparent and easy to follow how your final price sums up. If there is a problem you can see it immediatelly and fix it, not just at the end.
2. The wifi, especially the reconnecting of devices was perfect. No big hustle or anything once you initaly connected. Speed was very good.
3. Windows to open and let fresh air in, even in the 34th floor. And to all which complain about noise from outside they should check if the windows are closed. When we came in the window was a little open for fresh air but after closing the noise level was good

We enjoyed our stay there very much and I can only recommend it

title: Thank you, Dominique!
text: A beautiful stay! Clean, great staff and amazing views. This was the second time staying at the hotel. Dominique, in particular, was so helpful and went above and beyond to make the stay enjoyable and perfect. Incredible customer service!

title: Beautiful Hotel! Great Staff!
text: I loved my stay at the Virgin Hotels New York City. The staff was excellent, the location in the city was perfect and the property blew me away. I plan to return to the Virgin Hotels next time I visit New York City.

title: Great bedrooms, awful service.
text:
Bedrooms are fantastic with some excellent views, well located for all the sites and business, but we really felt service was extremely poor especially for such an iconic brand…..

1. On two occasions having to wait over 1.5hrs for food/drinks
2. Pool bar staff unable to open bottles of wine
3. Incorrect wine being served - and attempting to be charged
4. Glass at the poolside
5. Rude staff unfamiliar with the ‘In The Know’ cocktails advertised in reception
6. On one particular occasion a bar tender was extremely rude to my friend when he asked to see the menu, to be told he could order anything, on doing so he was told it wasn’t on the menu!
7. Upon checking out I asked twice for the bill to be emailed too me, it’s yet to arrive, thankfully I took a paper copy on the third attempt 
8. Prior to arrival we asked reception to help book a restaurant - no reply was ever received 
9. Pool was open to non-residents despite guidance to the contrary. Often hard to get a sun-bed.

We did report this to reception but our feedback was not followed up at the time. The GM later asked for feedback but sadly no reply.

Give it some time and suspect this will be a tremendous hotel but I’d avoid for quite a while yet.

title: Disappointed
text:
We arrived to the hotel with two small children and an 11 month old, the reception team were lovely but we were a little thrown back about the $38 daily charge for entertainment (WiFi and band). They confirmed WiFi was free but this was an entertainment fee, this threw me a little but we were a little too tired after travelling from London so just agreed. We were shown to our room and sadly it was covered in hairs (both kinds). Not just a few but clumps near the bed, shower, toilet and the seat at the vanity table was riddled with them. I called three times to have our room cleaned because I didn’t want my baby crawling around or any of us taking our shoes off. No one came. It was eventually cleaned three hours later!! We asked for a cot and it arrived with no bedding, when we came back from our evening out after asking twice there was still no bedding.

The pool was great, amazing views and the staff there very friendly, however, they served you a bottle of warm rose with no ice bucket, they had hardly any of the drinks on the menu available and the lifeguard spent the WHOLE time on his phone. The pool is open to the general public so lots of parties happen in the afternoon so it’s unlikely you get a bed. It’s a shame that this isn’t a resident only hotel.

Restaurant staff were very friendly and service was good.

Upon checking out we settled our bill and four hours later we got charged $67 dollars for room charge, no authorisation, no follow up email/confirmation and the only thing we had during our three nights there was a $8 dollar IPA. It has been over a week now and I still haven’t received any confirmation of a refund for this charge.

This hotel could be a lot better but there is definitely a lack of communication between departments and I feel there is very little management/overseeing of what is actually going on. 

I never like to write negative comments as I spent years in hospitality and things do go wrong but I feel there were so many and I’m still chasing now for the overcharge.

title: New Nomad hotel
text:

In the room there are a few buttons which let the team know if your room needs to be serviced or not, green is room needs to be serviced, red is no service, which wasn’t explained to us & figured out a few days into our stay.
We didn't get to explore the hotel much as the 3rd & 4th floors were being used for events and closed off for guests & the pool wasn’t open for the season yet.
I would try a return on a future visit and hopefully everything will go more smoothly.

It is true that I become a fan of Virgin more!

We enjoyed the bay scallops, the cheeseburger and scallops. After eating we hung out on the huge patio and had some drinks. Great view and fun atmosphere. Definitely going to be coming back when in town.

How they can charge a $35 a night (plus sales tax) amenities fee when they haven't opened the pool area or bar and the wifi had to be signed into every signal time you re-entered the building is beyond me. No one said the pool wasn't going to be open. We had problems with room cleaning, no safe, bill errors, broken a/c. They gave me a night back after a huge mix up where we were tole we were moving rooms and to pack our bags, then to be told we were staying put, but I would rather have paid teh money and not had the hassle. They did leave a lovely Anniversary charcuterie plate in our room, that was definitely the sort of vibe I was expecting. When the hotel settles and opens everything it had promised, I think it would be worth a visit but for now, I'd avoid it. Also don't bother downloading teh LUCY App or being in The Know, the App doesn't work and we didn't get any benefit at all from being in The Know, it's just an excuse to bombard you with marketing
