text: We loved our stay at Virgin Hotels NYC! The view from our room was incredible, and unlike other NYC hotels we have stayed at in the past we heard very little street noise. We slept great, the bed was super comfortable. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Virgin Hotels - simply amazing
text: The best stay in NYC I have ever had. The rooms are quite big for New York standards, the staff wee welcoming and a good rate as well for booking late. Clean, a short walk to Times Square and all the buzz that is NYC. Loved it would 100% stay again. Amazing value, service and stay. Would definitely recommend to all family and friends.

title: Great hotel. Spectacular room views. Fresh and modern
text:
Our stay at Virgin Hotels NYC was overall a great and a enjoyable one. The hotel is still new and fresh, so the facilities were overall modern and clean. 

From the outside, the hotel looks great and upon walking into reception, it is a trendy and quirky ares with welcoming and friendly staff. There is a bag area if you arrive early or on check out day if you have day plans.

We paid for an Empire Room and as expected, had speculator views of The Empire State Building. It was almost definitely the best view I have had, staying in a city hotel. The bedroom is separated from the 'living' area and the shower and toilet are separate, which was great. The room came with an iron, air dryer, free safe, dressing gowns etc. so all the mod cons and luxuries were included, which also included luxury hair wash, condition and body wash.

The bed was large and super comfy and came with a large TV mounted on the wall in front. The window in the bedroom was unusual and opened as a square outwards about 10 inches, so you could get fresh air, even on the 26th floor, though as we found out the hard way, close it if it starts to rain, otherwise you'll flood the immediate area within the room. 

The hotel has two rooftop bars, which were unfortunately closed and both booked out for 'private events' for the entire week we was there, which was highly disappointing for both to be utilised and paying guests ignored for the experience and privilege. Everdene bar and restaurant is on the 3rd floor and was lively and great, but service was pretty non-existent. 

The only negatives: 

Upon entering the room on our arrival, we found a dirty pair of underwear, clearly from the previous guest and that the cleaner had missed. We told reception and it was removed by the cleaner whilst we was out and perhaps I was expecting too much, but for the high end hotel chain it is, I expected something to say sorry. 

The room also has a lovely SMEG fridge inside, which whilst it looks lovely, my god does it make some loud noises during the night. It got to the point that we had to pull the plug out each night before bed.

Despite these, the hotel was pretty amazing and is highly recommended. I would almost certainly stay again when in NYC.

title: Amazing place in the middle of New York city
text:
The location of the hotel is amazing. Walking distance from plenty of shopping and restaurants as well as landmarks.
The rooms are amazing the beds are super comfortable and the staff is one of a kind.

title: Everdene's Cabaret Brunch - you were fab-u-lous
text: We visited Everdene for the Cabaret Brunch - it was the most amazing experience for a brunch EVER, the food was divine, the prosecco perfect. Everyone from the host (with the most), to the lady stilt walker (then roller blader), performers and not forgetting the DJ - I can't describe just how fabulous each and every member of this brilliantly fun team was. It made my 50th birthday celebrations one I will remember forever.  Hope they do this at other Virgin's hotels. Highly recommend a visit and no charge for the show just for your brunch and drinks!

title: Awesome new hotel
text: Greatly enjoyed my stay at this new property - centrally located, spacious rooms, and comfortable bed. The large windows provided fantastic views of the city. Looking forward to returning during my future NYC trips

title: Would not recommend. Stay at a more established hotel that has their stuff in order
text: We were very disappointed in this property. We had to be moved to a different room because the pillow and headboard smelt like urine in our first room. Once we were moved to the next room, we still ended up with more issues: stains on the sofa cover and whenever you would grab the shower head it would pull apart from the hose. Room service was also hit and miss. Breakfast was terrible and whenever we ordered dinner and asked for ketchup, mustard, etc in the notes -- sometimes they would bring it and other times completely ignore our request.

title: Exorbitant pricing and poor service - stay away
text:
Booked a night here as a mini stay-cation for my boyfriend's birthday. We've walked by it and spend a lot of time in the area, so thought it would be fun to mix it up and stay at a nice new spot. 

We arrived early on the day we were checking in to drop our bags off. To our surprise, the room was ready (~10AM) - everything went downhill from there. We asked where we could find some coffee in the hotel before we set out for the day. The lobby directed us to the third floor bar area. We later found out this is the only food/drink area open in the whole hotel. The staff seemed very confused by our request but poured us two cups to go and we left. Then, the waiter chased us down and asked us to sign a bill for the coffee: $16 for two cups of sub-par hotel drip coffee!! If we had known, we certainly would've gone elsewhere (we assumed this would be free!).

The next morning, we returned to the restaurant for breakfast. The service was terrible and the food was McDonalds quality. Our breakfast sandwich was advertised to be served with "aged cheddar cheese"....it was sliced American cheese. Didn't even try to hide it. Our $16 "fruit bowl" was a small cup with small sliced fruit (not even fresh). The wait staff didn't know who was attending to which tables, and one of the servers spilled water all over me and didn't notice or apologize.

When it was time to check out, we waited on line in the lobby for over thirty minutes. They were incredibly understaffed for a Sunday morning check out. The staff seemed oblivious to the 10-plus-person line. I booked my stay under a promotion and the discount wasn't applied. When I made my reservation, pool access was advertised. When we checked in, I found out the pool won't be open for another few days/weeks.

The only reason I'm giving two stars vs one is because the bed is actually very comfortable. The view was okay, but for the price I would definitely stay at another hotel in the area for the same view and better service. I definitely wouldn't recommend this to a friend/family member. Price to stay was exorbitant.

title: Fantastic
text: I stayed in this hotel with my partner for a week trip away to NYC, I must say; we was a bit dubious at first when we booked as it’s a brand new hotel and would of course have teething issues, however, it was faultless, the hotel location is perfect, the staff were super nice and the decor and rooms are outstanding. We had a room on floor 26 and the view of the empire state was out of this world, it advertised correct with this!! The check in and out was easy and hassle free.  The bar on the 3rd floor was also good. The swimming pool and roof top bar was not accessible yet so a bit disappointed in that, but to be expected with a brand new hotel. Overall this was an excellent choice of hotel and I would be happy to recommend to others and stay again myself.

title: A fun new property.
text: My husband and I just spent two nights at the Virgin Hotel NYC.  We had a fun time. The view from our room, which was on there 24th floor, was amazing.  And the food and the service in the restaurant were both excellent, though I truly do wish they would rethink those tacky red velour outfits they have the female waitstaff wearing. The lobby is not at all impressive. The elevators are so high tech that they are a bit tricky to use.  I fear that, once the pool and the exhale spa have opened, the rates might be a bit steep for us to make a return visit.  However it was fun for just one time.  Honestly, I am also just not sure that our room was large enough to command a higher price.  So we'll see how they do.

title: Stylish & Comfortable!
text: The hotel exceeded my expectations. The room had a smart layout with a changing area and makeup vanity and a beyond comfortable bed and sheet set. I loved the attached couch and work/dining table. I had my best sleep at a hotel in a very long time.

title: Stunning Location great views and top top staff
text: Happy to stayed for one of the best views available in Manhattan, great great location making the Apple walkable to anywhere. Food and Bar experience tops and good gym - so much more to come when the refurb is done - I will go back

title: Everything great except elevator
text: Everything great except the complicated elevator. Not intuitive and need a staff persons help so if they are busy you must wait to get to room. Elevator very complicated. Everything else including cleanliness and simplicity great.

title: Room with a view
text:
Pros….
The bed and the bedding were fabulous, the room was spacious and even the robes were lovely. We booked a sky chamber Empire view and the view from the room really was something special. 

Cons….
The pool was closed. The soundproofing of the room was non-existent. Amazes me that a 5* hotel can be so noisy. The internal blinds are great at blocking out the light but they are on a loud pulley system and as soon as the people in the surrounding rooms open or close their blinds you’re all wide awake. We were on the 25th floor and the street noise was just ridiculous. We were up at 4am on the first morning as there was a street cleaning machine working away below and we may as well have been right next to it. Music, traffic, sirens. Yes I expect NY to be noisy but equally I expect my 5* room to shield me from it just a bit. Add to that the beautiful but incredibly noisy Smeg fridge and there’s no hope. We had to leave the fridge unplugged after the first night, and we couldn’t use the air com for the same reason. It was pretty hot in there but it was just unusable due to the noise.

The coffee machine didn’t work very well, it crushed both of the only two pods provided so bring plenty of your own pods, and buy milk, because you don’t get that either. Also unusual not to be provided with any bottled water for the room. So bring that too!

I emailed ahead and asked them if they could make a fuss of my son for his 13th birthday and they did send a piece of cake up but sadly fresh cream and four days early…. They said they’d get back to me with some restaurant details but never did. It’s also pretty annoying that they give you access to a membership/reward scheme (“The Know”) which promises a free upgrade subject to availability and then you’re told that you’ve already paid for the room they would have upgraded you to…. Would have been better not to mention it, surely?! 

I’m not sure it’s really a 5*. I was happy with it, but only really because of the spectacular view. If you can cope with the noise then I’d recommend an Empire room.

title: The hippest of the hip hotels in NYC.  Elegant and Modern.
text: The General Manager, Candice Cancino, is simply the finest GM in NYC.  Her staff, especially Louis the bellman, are very attentive, genuine, and anticipatory.  The hotel is a gem.  Modern, clean, cozy.  The room layout is efficient and fun.  The floor-to-ceiling views of the city, especially the Empire State Building, are breathtaking.

title: Buona base per NY
text:
Hotel di nuovissima concezione a due passi dall’Empire State Building. Dalla terrazza del bar al terzo piano si può godere di una bellissima vista. 
Il panorama dalla camera (la nostra aveva un’esposizione angolare ad est) é fantastico e permette di ammirare l’Empire State Building, il Chrysler e le splendide luci di New York.
In reception il servizio é cortese e puntuale, il personale é pronto a rispondere a qualsiasi domanda e ad esaudire ogni richiesta. 
Ho dato 4 punti e non 5 solo per questa nuova tendenza degli architetti moderni, che pare ormai inevitabile, di “ripensare” i bagni in modo alternativo, a discapito della privacy e della praticità: qui ci sono due vani separati: uno per la doccia, l’altro per il wc, chiuso da due porte in vetro satinato. 
I lavandini sono invece fuori, nel punto di passaggio tra la porta d’ingresso e la camera da letto. 
Un “bagno diffuso” che per forza di cose rende più  disordinato l’ambiente.
Peccato, perché per il resto l’hotel rasenta la perfezione: offre in dotazione ogni comfort, dalle ciabatte, agli accappatoi, da ferro e asse da stiro per “emergenze”, al servizio di lavanderia, nonché asciugacapelli, ombrello in caso di pioggia e tappetino per lo yoga.

Prese di corrente, USB e caricatori distribuiti con generosità.
Wi-Fi veloce in tutta la struttura. 

Davvero un bel posto dove soggiornare.

title: Hotel and staff nice.. close to everything
text:
Staff is friendly. Joey was an excellent bartender.. rooms were comfy . Our only issue was that the room
Was not ready at check in and we were asked to wait at restaurant area .. we had 10 month old with us and I had to change him on floor of bathroom as there was no changing station and room was not ready .. other than that our stay was wonderful!

title: Needs a lot of work
text: Location is a bit lost.  Despite attempt at a high-tech streamlined user experience, elevators are hard to use, phone app is complete garbage, staff is confused about it's own breakfast policy for packages they sell, and there are some cheap fixtures in the hotel.  Toilet was clogged and maintenance team fixed it but left a huge mess that was not present on their arrival.  Common issue, room was not fully cleaned and towels were not swapped out.  Pretty expensive given the glitches and their impact on user experience.  Great location and spectacular views if you have a good room,  but prepare to be annoyed.

title: Diamond in the rough?
text:
Nice hotel (brand new) with great location and modern, stylish rooms.  Probably worth a 4-5* rating if they had their act together.  

2* because:  

1.  Our room service order took close to 2hrs to arrive, and was cold and inedible, but no one picking up phones at room service or front desk, so we basically went to bed hungry and frustrated.  Granted, it was their opening night shebang, with Sir Richard presiding (see photos), but frankly that’s no excuse since it wasn’t unforeseen and they should’ve planned better to ensure normal guests didn’t have the experience we did;  

2.  After checking out we received a $7.22 minibar charge afterwards, despite us consuming nothing from the minibar (who does that these days anyway, especially with tons of convenience stores steps away from the hotel where you can purchase the same things for a fraction?).  Again, this seemed to be a staffing / management issue since literally within minutes of us checking into our room there was a knock on the door from the “minibar concierge” wanting to check our minibar consumption.  Clearly confused since when I mentioned we’d just checked in, he became flustered and scurried away.  Our bill was over $3K, so $7.22 is nothing but irritating to have to deal with.  Let’s hope they do get their act together as a new property, since if it’s downhill from here, god help them!

title: Awful!!!!!
text: Worst experience I’ve had in a hotel in decades. Arrived and no one to help with bags. My wife almost fell trying to pick up a heavy bag. Next day we couldn’t get into our room  and missed out dinner

title: Classy, comfortable, we will return!
text: The Virgin knows what they’re doing. The front desk hosts were amazing. Always pleasant with a wonderful attitude, which is hard to find these days. The location is perfect! Nice section of midtown, safe and close to many train stops. The rooftop bar/ restaurant was great. The room was incredible, our favorite room yet. Floor to ceiling windows with amazing views.

title: Wonderful stay
text:
We had the pleasure of staying three nights in this beautiful hotel in the center of Manhattan. A warm welcome during check in made us feel appreciated.
Our room had direct view towards the Empire State Building and the whole family spent every morning looking out on the morning activities in the streets.
We tried the restaurant and bar where the atmosphere was magical with live music and comfortable chairs and sofas. The food was good, however the service could have been faster, but this will probably improve when routines have been established. This is a new hotel after all.
I can definitely recommend this hotel for families.

title: Excellent stay at Virgin
text: Three adults were very comfortable in our double bedroom. The design of the room was excellent - all spaces were considered and well designed so you could use all the square footage. Beds and pillows were comfortable. The shower/toilet area was spacious. We never felt like we didn't have enough space to get ready or relax. Staff at the front desk and restaurant were friendly and always welcoming. I'd stay here again - I thought it was worth the cost and not overpriced for what you get!

title: Stylish Hotel with insufficient Staff
text: Very stylish and modern. Nice location. But they wanted to charge 2000 Dollars more than in our booking confirmation. No apologizes at the end, though they were wrong. A pity for this nice hotel, because this unprofessional behaviour was my last Impression. I felt That I couldn“t trust anyone there.

title: Awesome
text: Great staff, clean and fresh. Beds are a little small and not a lot of room for luggage but it's New York. There are some minor issues that need to be addressed but the hotel has only been open a few months and I believe they will be working on them.

title: Great Location, Still Working Out Some Issues
text: The rooms are great, and the location is good. I wanted to love it, but was left just liking it. All the technology is great until it doesn't work, and then it is hard to get a resolution. When your digital key on your phone stops working, you can't get in the elevator or your room. The "touch-sensitive" ice machines are basically non-functional. And staff, while friendly, still needs training on the area, making recommendations, etc. I will give it another chance once it is fully open and staff has had some more time to get in the groove.

title: Look no further…..
text: Loved everything about it!! My husband and I were traveling to celebrate his birthday. We literally booked the Virgin hotel the night before we arrived. Not expecting much, I wrote a comment that we would love a great view, high floor for the celebration. Upon arrival, I believe her name was Tracy, welcomed my husband with a Happy Birthday and assured us they have a great room for the occasion. Room 2704 was perfect! Amazing views of the Empire State Building. The staff also sent a bottle of bubbly, sleeve of macaroons and balloons as a nice surprise that evening. Every time we walked through the lobby we were greeted by all staff members.  Loved how high tech everything is.. from the elevators to the lights in the rooms. The Smeg fridge is a nice touch! We never heard any noise from within the hotel at night. Loved the toiletries (scent was amazing), the comfortable bedding and great room layout. Staff and drinks at the rooftop bar were also on point. Anto was extremely friendly giving us advice on the restaurant and entertainment. Virgin, you outdid yourselves! Your newest members will be back!!!

title: Really really bad management lack of training and lots of things not working
text:
Awful experience and will list the reasons 
1. The email for corresponding does not work . It comes back undeliverable 
2. The phone key card does not work 
3. The physical key card is really bad and clunky and doesn’t really work very well a terrible design 
4. I took the breakfast option for an extra amount and yet then despite four different people at the hotel confirming breakfast is included I then get a bill where they charged me breakfast . On phoning them they say in fact it’s a25 dollar credit yet no where does it say that and all staff told me it’s covered in full . So clearly no staff are properly trained and it’s totally misleading the on line booking as it doesn’t mention this anywhere that it’s a small credit only. In fact I think the credit was less than the actual amount I paid to include breakfast 

The rooms themselves are nice albeit a bit weird you walk straight into bathroom area from front door 

The outdoor bar area is  also nice

title: Una estancia inmejorable en NYC
text: La ubicacion es sencillamente genial, puedes ir andando a muchisimos sitios de interés,. El hotel es fantastico, las habitaciones super comodas y grandes, y el ambiente del hotel es genial. Repetiremos sin duda.

title: I wanted to love it but…..
text:
I never quite get why new build hotels massively fail to soundproof from the outside world. I get it stands right on Broadway but it’s ever so noisy, mostly from the outdoor speakers on the roof deck but also not helped by the cute but extremely noisy Smeg fridge! I ended up having to move on night three as the bass from the bar was driving me crazy and had to unplug the fridge! I was then moved to a room with broken air con and still noisy! I guess if you want a restful night you’ve got to pay for the pleasure by upgrading to a high floor room. 
 
The bed was kind of comfy, the blackout curtains were anything but which hung irregular and didn’t meet, the curtain instead of a wardrobe door massively cheapens what could be a great dressing area and the luggage rack fits anything other than a standard sized case. 

Service was hit and miss from trying to make a booking on their website to eventually giving up and utilising booking.com. The bar lacks soul and atmosphere, feels like you’re sat in a corridor as if it was an after thought, skip it completely and sit on the roof deck which is pretty cool to be fair. 

The lady’s serving breakfast and on front desk do however deserve a shout out. They clearly know what they’re doing and the red jacket clad Colombian door man was always super helpful. 

I downloaded the app but using it as a key failed at every opportunity as well as curating your preferences that have zero worth. 

It kind of has CitizenM vibes but with a way heftier price tag. 

Also. What’s with the elevators….. they’ve a mind of their own…….???

title: Could be a great hotel
text: In pre official opening stage so a list of minor gripes I guess. Should have make it clear pool etc wasn’t open. Staff were friendly and the location was great. Everdene bar area was a fun space. Elevators a triumph of style over practicality

title: Disappointing stay
text: I don't usually complain about bad service but the multiple phone calls about a beeping coming from an ice machine outside my door for over 14 hours while sleeping with a 6 month old baby and spouse was just the start. The everdene was average ate two salads and charged 12 dollars for waters was shocking. Coffee was again below average and overpriced at 10 dollars for a small latte. Just do better I've been to other Virgin Hotels and this was by far the worst.

title: The best NYC Hotel Choice
text: Had to try out the newest hotel in town.  Heart of NYC with it being very accessible to everything. The hotel is very nice and not your typical hotel.  Spacious common areas, unique room layouts and nice views.  There is a swimming pool, although too cold to swim in, I can see it as THE spot in the summertime.  Will come back when i'm back in NYC.  New favorite hotel.

title: Sleek Gorgeous New Hotel
text: What an experience at this brand new hotel in the heart of Manhattan!  It’s stylish and sleek with a gorgeous bar.  Second stay at this Virgin property and the brand does not disappoint. As a “Know Member” I received an upgrade with an incredible view of the city.  Will definitely be back!

title: GREAT STAY ! GREAT STAFF
text: Beautiful hotel . Front desk personnel are super friendly and helpful. Dominique was a pleasure. She was super informative & Genuinely took of us our entire stay . She gave excellent recommendations from restaurants, off broadway & on broadway shows to private tours. This will definitely be our New York home away from home. We will be back!

title: Subpar Service, But Good Overall.
text: The hotel lobby was cool looking and the staff were really friendly. The elevators were smart and super-fast. However, they did not clean the floors in rooms at all and the service overall was not good. We had to repeat simple requests in the restaurant, for example.

title: Great stay!
text: Had a great stay!  Great location.  Close to MSG, was there for the basketball game.  Close to good restaurants and convenient to subway.  Staff was very friendly.  Arranged for a driver for 6 AM day of check-out. Driver was there at 5:45 AM.

title: Great hotel, great location, great staff
text: Great hotel, great location, very kind and helpful staff, very comfortable beds, view from room very nice, had nice breakfast and some drinks served by very hospitable and friendlt staff, check in and check out very smooth.

title: Great hotel, nicest staff
text:
Hotel is located great, all staff were so helpful and friendly, starting at the reception and on to the launch manager . The personal attitude gave us a very nice feeling.
The room is spacious and the bed was very comfortable. The big windows bring in a lot of light and the view is open and not blocked by buildings.
We will definitely be back

title: worst hotel experience. worst customer service.
text: employees and the DIRECTOR HIMSELF WAS VERY RUDE!!! They messed up on their end and denied to tell me who i spoke to before on the phone that gave me different answer. One of the employee even told me “if you can’t afford to stay you shouldn’t have even come” when they clearly charged my card and even threatened to call the police when i was being very patient with them to handle their mistake. I will NEVER be coming back and will also be making sure others DO NOT either. WORST experience of my life. That isn’t how you treat your customers.

title: Not ready for guests yet
text:
Tried to contact the hotel by mail and their app for some pre-arrival anniversary arrangements but with no reply. So much for being in ”The Know”. No other perks or special info came with being a member either.
The hotel was said to be ready in February 2023 but when staying there in March the top floor (with the view) was empty, the pool deck was empty, the gym was not ready, the red stairs you see on photos on the Internet was closed for ”ordinary” guests. No signs anywhere to help you find  the bar or restaurant or any social areas at all.
The ”chamber” was tidy but had almost no storage room.
The hotel felt safe and the location is great but if you are not an influencer of some sort and getting treated like one, this might not be for you. I doubt they even noticed we came, stayed & left.

title: Great stay with excellent staff
text:
Lovely hotel, in the right area for a New York visit.
I was so impressed with the staff in every area of the hotel.
Keep up the good work!! 
We were a combination of friends traveling from California and Ireland and both groups loved the hotel equally.

title: So nice
text: So nice, Comfy beds and pillows. Separate shower room, WC & sink area which reduced morning time delays . Lovely staff. Expensive  mini bar prices per TV app so we didn't touch them. Very near Harold Sq subway with numerous lines,

title: Great Staycation
text: We stayed here for my husband’s 50th birthday and it was great. The chamber rooms are spacious. My 6yr old wants to live there. The views are  amazing. You get to see some of NY most famous skyscrapers.

title: Very bad experience
text: Bizarre room layout. Bathroom is huge empty space. Not enough light, not enough mirrors, not enough storage. Our room was never serviced. The second night the shower curtain fell down. We mentioned it to the manager after the first night but it the room was never serviced by the second night. This really hurts Virgin's image in our minds.

title: Not a Virgin Anymore
text: First time staying at a Virgin property and it wont be my last.  The property is great.  Its very spacious and clean. I see they have a pool but it was too cold when I went.  The property has great views of NYC. Rooms are bright and clean.  Very different from your standard hotel room. I will be back.

title: Great Hotell !!
text:
Stayed four nights and it was great. Perfect location and Amazing wiev from the room. Staff was superhelpfull and supernice, i can easy recomend this hotel.
The hotell was brand new, and i guess it will be a populare  one moving  forward. The friendly tone between the staff created a good atmosfare and a key for sucess. 😊

title: New Hotel for my NYC Trips
text:
Booked a 2 night stay at the hotel for a work conference.  Checkin was a breeze.  Most likely overstaffed as there were 4 people behind the desk and just me checking in the lobby area. Rooms are unique, bright and clean with great views of the city.  Definitely beats most, if not all, of the properties I have stayed in when in NYC. 
The bar/restaurant area on the 3rd floor is spacious! Was not busy and perfect for work and a glass of wine. Elevators took a few tries getting used to but they're fine. 
I will come back when the property is open 100%.

title: Wow!
text: What a great 3 nights at the Virgin in New York!  My daughter took me to New York for my birthday and the hotel was just perfect.  Dinner at Everdene was magical and the best service I've ever experienced.

title: Best Sleep in NYC
text: Not only are staff exceptional but the accommodations are stellar. You can sink into your bed and relax.  Enjoy the wonderful amenities without having to leave your hotel or your room !!  Great location, easy access to multiple sites.

title: Groovy new hotel
text: Had the pleasure of staying with friends at Virgin Hotel NYC. It has been open for only 1 month. I was a bit reticent when my friend suggested we try-thought it may be cheesy. It was anything but-a cool and swanky hotel that has the boutique feel. Say hello to Glen at the front desk-such a great brand ambassador. The hip no touch elevators, cool hallways and small but luxurious rooms will keep you happy. Delicious drinks and breakfast. They even have a jewelry holder-how cool! Great location for getting downtown. Be sure to book mini golf around at Swingers around the corner-

title: Fabulous stay at the Virgin Hotels NYC
text: The chamber room concept was fantastic! The rooms are a nice size for NYC standards and the floor to ceiling windows with views of the Empire State Building were great. Being a new hotel, everything seemed very clean and in pristine condition.  Customer service was wonderful, we were constantly greeted by the front desk and even met Candace the general manager in the elevator. Overall, I highly recommend!

title: Wanted to love it…still work to do
text: Thought I’d be more impressed by the brand new Virgin Hotel in NoMad than I was after experiencing it. Staff was efficient and friendly. Everdene the restaurant is not fully operational yet so we passed on eating there. Bar was small but nice. The bed really disappointed me as it was soft as if it was worn out from use with spots I sunk into. Not a heavenly comfort experience. Room layout was cool with toilet and shower off in separate areas with doors. Great shade system. Nice views from the room. High tech to point I needed to learn how to work the elevator. Price of room was decent deal for our stay.

title: New York Summit
text: We had a wonderful company event that was well planned, comfortable spaces and excellent food and beverage services. Our dining experience for lunch and all meals were excellent with many different healthy options.  A wonderful experience. Thank you and I will be back!

title: New and great staff !
text: Overall I can’t say enough about the staff here. They treat you so well and made the extra effort to take care of you . Rooms are great with a full mini bar though expensive they had a ton of items to choose from. Korea town is super fun and overall you will have a great NYC experience. Only negative was roof top bar isn’t opened yet and the gym isn’t ready to be opened.

title: Disappointing experience at Everdean at the Virgin Hotel
text: I spent a 4 hour meal here with a group for a work dinner. It took 1.5 hours to receive a glass of wine, and should have left then. We thought the service might improve and that after speaking with our server, maybe things would speed up. The service staff and restaurant manager did not seem to acknowledge or care. The food was okay but after waiting for so long with no regard or apology, I could never think to return.  Very disappointed.

title: Very good hotel
text: The room is great, really well designed with a lot of features in a small space. Bed was comfy, shower was excellent. It was really nice to have the little sofa/banquette next to the bed to have a place for 2 to sit with a small table. The only thing I'd upgrade is the toilet paper!

title: Superior Stay at Virgin Hotel
text: Not a single issue or problem. Location is great, near everything for me. Room comfort, service, staff, food, cocktails - all SUPERIOR. I was on the 27th floor and the view facing 6th avenue was magnificent. Empire State BLDG, Chrysler etc. Sunrise was spectacular.

title: Great new spot in the city!
text: Virgin has done a great job of infusing their brand into this new property in Midtown.  And it is NEW.  New construction gives this a very special feel where there are windows and light and purpose of design in every space.  We had a corner room that looked right at the Empire State building which was fun and the general location is very central to anywhere you want to go in the city.  The beds were comfortable and nicely appointed.  Not a lot of closet space or space for luggage is the only downfall but if you are traveling light or only there for a short stay it is no problem.  Great amenities.  Staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Soft opening - many issues to resolve.
text:
No tea in room 
Coffee cup has to be held while you brew
Sink is off centre. Can barely get hands under fawcet. 
Cleaners did not pay attention to rooms. 
Front desk staff was lovely but for a half full
Hotel service was below par.

title: Beautiful hotel, but vibes are off
text:
Beautiful hotel, very modern and great views and in a great location. Room size is bigger than most in NYC. But surprisingly little storage in rooms for a promoted dressing room. 

Hate to put this on blast, but the staff was wonderful except for one woman we talked to one the phone. We picked up the phone and pressed the “Yes” button, but maybe we misinterpreted this. 

The first night, after drinking the waters in the room, we called and asked for some water bottles, like some arrowhead whatever. First night they came no questions asked. Next night… woman on the phone says we should not have been given those waters, that they’re for staff only, with a tone that made us feel as if we’re stealing their only water rations. Ok we bought 5 $6 bottles on the TV (street prices mini bar?). Next day we asked for some water from housekeeping and I heard her get lit up about how this is ridiculous and we should not be attempting to steal the water and if we want them we know we have to buy them. Never been rejected water only for the option to be to buy $6 water. Mind you the water in the bathroom was cloudy, maybe new plumbing, aerator, I’m sure it was fine, but very unappealing. 

I wouldn’t have written this if we were kindly directed to purchase them, but the tone, even overhearing her talk to housekeeping oof. Very uncomfy and unwelcoming. 

Anyways, beautiful hotel, but the water sitch left a poor taste in our mouth. Especially at a hotel that boasts a fun party vibe, didn’t you expect us to be left a little dehydrated.

title: Outstanding views and spacious rooms !!
text:
Such a great addition to the Nomad area, the new Virgin is a beautiful property with outstanding views of the city !! Rooms are spacious and well designed, especially for a hotel in NYC. 
can’t wait to come on the summer for their outdoors patios !

title: Nyc trip
text:
Stayed here this past weekend and had the most fantastic time! The rooms are larger than most NYC rooms I have stayed in. Decor is very chic and downright sexy. Drinks at Everdene were awesome, food looked and smelled great but we did not get a chance to eat there. Check in and out was very smooth and the doorman was the friendliest I have ever encountered. Perfect location in NoMad close to ktown, chelsea with lots of great restaurants and cocktail bars. It also doesn't hurt to wake up the the empire state building right outside of your window.
We did not get a chance to bring our dogs but love that it is pet friendly! Even with dogs around - we noticed no pet hair or dander, showing that housekeeping is hard at work!
We will absolutely be back and will plan to stay here with any future visits to NYC.

title: Welp. It's Definitely NEW . . .
text:
We expected some "growing pains", but would give this hotel some more time. Their heart is in the right place, but the property isn't quite what one expects of the brand. . . yet. 
Hand in there, Virgin.

title: A perfect spot
text: We stayed at the hotel to celebrate my birthday. The hotel was centrally located to a ton of restaurants, bars, coffee, dessert, and shopping. There is a little something for everyone. The staff were all warm and welcoming and would definitely consider coming back again for our next mini getaway. We also will recommend to our family and friends looking for a place to stay when visiting NYC!

title: Amazing Staff and hotel.
text:
My partner and I went on a cruse with Virgin Voyage, and fell in love with the brand and the hospitality  they showed,  that when we  heard there was a hotel coming to NYC and opening right around his birthday so we  decided to celebrate in the city and stay a night here. 
We had amazing views of the city, one world observatory and the sunset.  Compared to other hotels I've stayed in around the area the rooms are much bigger and more comfortable.
If you stay here, be sure to visit Everdene. We went for breakfast and the food was amazing.
Thank you to the staff and GM Ms. Cancino for the hospitality they have shown towards us and for making our stay here a memorable one. I can't wait to visit again in the summer.

title: Amazing hotel right near Times Square!
text: Amazing new hotel! Awesome design, great service. In the middle of everything. Staff is friendly, and very accommodating! We celebrated our 25th anniversary here this weekend, and they made it super special!! The views from your room are everything!

title: Great new hotel in New York very clean, friendly staff with awesome gym and facilities. All in a very good location
text: very clean, friendly staff with awesome gym and facilities. All in a very good location in central Manhattan. Provides great value for money. I would highly recommend for couples or families. Very comfortable rooms.

title: Outstanding staff and hotel
text: We've had the most wonderful time in this lovely new hotel. Upon the time of booking there weren't any reviews but we took the chance and it's been superb. Staff (Glen was brill) are so friendly and helpful, restaurant amazing and the views are to die for. The bedding and the beds were outstanding, not too hard and not too soft, it was just perfect. Location is brilliant, not too close to Times Sq for the noise and walking distance to mostly anywhere. We will definitely be back, well done on your lovely new hotel!

title: Valentines via Virgin Hotel NYC 🗽
text:
Truly enjoyed my stay as I pre-booked my room before opening. I had lunch with my mother earlier in the day who also loved the hotel and decor. The bed was extremely comfortable, had the most epic sleep ever. Visited the Everdene briefly, also lovely lounge/club. 
All in all phenomenal 1 night stay, staff was very friendly and diverse! Cudos for hiring ethnic, and young black and latinos! Jennifer and Johnathan at the front desk were especially friendly and helpful. Will definitely be back!!!

title: Fun stay
text: Surrounding area would feel rough for someone who are not familiar with New York city. Room was smart use of the space, modern.  Empire state building View from the room was very nice.  Noise from Mini refrigerator kept us up though.

title: Beautifully designed "chambers" made my stay fun and efficient
text: The rooms are "chambers" with a sliding door that allows you to close the bed area from the dressing, shower/toilet and workspace area. It  provides ample room to put down a yoga mat and move - now that is a luxury in NYC! Staff were super efficient and very kind.  Gotta go to the library on the 3rd floor - a real jewel for a bite or drink...

title: Exceptional Experience With A Fresh and Modern Touch
text: The Virgin NYC offers you a robust well-appointed room that does not lack in any areas on quality or features. The views from the room were just breathtaking of the Empire State Building. Their standard chamber guest room was well-planned in offering comfortable and usable accommodations. The lighting for the room was first-rate as you could control the levels of how bright and dark you wanted the room- a dream come true. The bed and linens were comfortable and made of high quality. Early check-in was a huge score. All of the staff were pleasant and very professional. An excellent choice that offers well-appointed accommodations in the heart of midtown.

title: Great Hotel
text: Gorgeous hotel with incredible views. My 9 year old son looked out the window and screamed that he saw the Empire State Building. Like anywhere in NYC, the rooms are on the smaller side but they are very well done. I meant to ask where I could get one of their bathrobes…possibly the most comfortable I’ve ever experienced. The staff are truly happy to be there and go out of their way to help. The housekeeping was sweet, polite, and on top of everything. The only issue we had was room service we had to call for my son. Everything came incorrectly but they were swamped so there wasn’t any purpose in complaining. For a new hotel they were stretched thin that night. Otherwise fabulous.

title: Hotel Preview
text: I was invited to preview the Virgin Hotels New York City after a stay in another city and had a lovely time. The location was so convenient, and the view of the city was breathtaking! I've stayed at other NYC hotels, and the room size was comfortable in comparison to others. I'd also like to compliment the on-site staff who were prompt, helpful, friendly, and made my stay truly a delightful one.

title: Style + comfort. Great hotel for all seasons (family sightseeing, party weekend, romantic getaway, business travelers)
text: Compared to the Manhattan hotels I’ve stayed in before Virgin was def an upgrade in cleanliness, style, comfort, and location. NEVER staying in TIME SQUARE again.  ITS ALL ABOUT NOMAD.   No sleazy TS riffraff but still a great place  to experience the sites and sounds of the Big Apple. Best  hotel view in NYC I ever had. Staff was friendly.  Made my 5 yo laugh and feel at home. Next visit to NYC, plan to stay here with just my wife.

title: An experience in the city
text: Rooms are clean, views are peaceful, it’s an overall beautiful property in a good area. Me and my friends loved it. You can’t get a bad view. If you’re ever in the new york area and need a place to stay I definitely recommend booking here.

title: The New Virgin in Nomad is Amazing!
text: Had a beautiful stay in the new Virgin in Nomad. The views are spectacular, and the design really well done. The pillow and linens on the bed were so perfect I wish I could buy them! Can not wait unitl they open the pool!

title: Virgin in the Big Apple
text:
This hotel was absolutely beautiful! They had just opened and everything was fresh and clean. The views from my chamber were incredible (ask for the Empire view!)

The Housekeeping team led by Scott, Joanne and Patricia were amazing! Their team kept my room super clean and any items I needed were delivered almost immediately!

Can't say enough about the Junction team, led by Dominique, Christina, Jailene and Pierre! You all have a team filled with rockstars! Thank you to Jennifer, Jeannette, Jonathan, Darnell, Glenn, Gabby, Denia, Tanika, Carla and Isaiah! Your hospitality and kindness will take you all a long way! Sir Richard must be very proud!

The staff in Everdene was also exceptional. Jenny at the hostess stand, Lisa and Joe the bartenders, and Dennis were all very kind and offered great recommendations.

Thank you again to all the staff for making my week in New York City an amazing experience. I can't wait to see you all again!

title: Delightful Addition in NYC
text:
I travel to NYC frequently for both business and for pleasure and have experienced the best of the best.  I’d say that the Brand New, Just Opened, Virgin Hotel hits the top of the mark for Great Hotels.  The rooms are well planned, contemporary and comfortable. And the Staff served up simply superb service and attention. 
Additionally we were able to take a break and go down to “Swingers” on the lower level and have a challenging round of Mini Golf… a great way to relax.
I’ll return soon.
